commit_message:
Remove LBaaS support from devstack

Devstack support for LBaaS is being migrated to an external
plugin in the neutron-lbaas repository.  The only LBaaS-
specific code that remains in devstack is a hook to support
existing configs that enable q-lbaas.  In that case, load
the external plugin if necessary.

This checkin is identical to commit
b124f4d595cc41b4f20bf935ffd0848448b3713c (Change-Id
I592f64407ccf1e722b8d9788917879d0236acf0b) that was reverted
by commit 93e682c558f954fa35a00d7cc6a6903e8ed59178 when the
neutron grenade tests were broken.  Those tests are being
fixed separately.

Change-Id: Ib747817e18daa289be6b2d3738c7984a424f10ac
Depends-On: I0b7434af4c5fdbd2b3cfa356c233f0596339d859

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 15:47:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/cmd/manage.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': "Fix cinder-manage volume delete cmd

Since pools was introduced in cinder, field 'host' in resources
contains pool part. So when we are trying to delete volume with
cinder-manage, 'host' with pool part passed to rpc target. As
result message isn't delivered to host, and we can't delete volume.

Change-Id: Ie6dcbbfe28dcc5b6dc838490b351a13b43936da9
Closes-Bug: 1468401
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder-manage volume delete cmd

Since pools was introduced in cinder, field 'host' in resources
contains pool part. So when we are trying to delete volume with
cinder-manage, 'host' with pool part passed to rpc target. As
result message isn't delivered to host, and we can't delete volume.

Change-Id: Ie6dcbbfe28dcc5b6dc838490b351a13b43936da9
Closes-Bug: 1468401

commit_message:
Updated from global requirements and don't list neutron in requirements.txt

Updated from global requirements.
Pin neutron to stable/kilo.
And do not list neutron in requirements.txt. It does not play nicely
with projects that are not publicly available in pypi.

Related Change-Id: Id8d2663e50b62915c2ed6426e378920042f9eed4
                   I9ac3c2bacdde7be45aa8c9f76e2a6d86508608d2

commit_message:
Remove oslo logging from backup unit tests

Many of the unit tests for backup services import oslo_log and
invoke LOG.debug, LOG.info, etc.  There appears to be no current
reason to do this and, more generally, unit tests for everything
but oslo_log itself should not be doing logging themselves.

This commit removes oslo logging from the backup unit tests.
Closes-bug: 1464772

Change-Id: I2c9f258a43a155e785bac4158cb5e5e0ecfcc797

subject: processutils: ensure on_completion callback is always called
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 16:37:04.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/processutils.py', 'oslo_concurrency/tests/unit/test_processutils.py'], 'message': 'processutils: ensure on_completion callback is always called

If the subprocess.Popen.communicate method raises an exception,
the on_completion callback is never invoked. If a caller is
trying to use on_execute + on_completion to track lifecycle
of a process this creates a problem, as they cannot reliably
detect completion.

Change-Id: I22b2d7bde8797276f7670bc289d915dab5122481
Closes-bug: #1470868
'}]
commit_message:
processutils: ensure on_completion callback is always called

If the subprocess.Popen.communicate method raises an exception,
the on_completion callback is never invoked. If a caller is
trying to use on_execute + on_completion to track lifecycle
of a process this creates a problem, as they cannot reliably
detect completion.

Change-Id: I22b2d7bde8797276f7670bc289d915dab5122481
Closes-bug: #1470868

commit_message:
Raises an error if the queue name is empty

If the queue name is empty, it does not send it to the server and
raises an exception instead.

closes bug: #1397177

Change-Id: I7742752c4bad0863d0eafa52cf4c7c89360cd108

commit_message:
Allow additional customization of HttpCheck

Documentation on HttpCheck detection plugin refers to things that do
not currently work in the plugin, like activating use_keystone.  This
change fixes that, and adds the ability to customize other http_check
parameters which were missing.

Change-Id: I2309b25f83f395dcd56914ba7cdfeac9b42c7481

load_check_directory() doesn't return a pathname but a dict containing

commit_message:
Add correct checks_d path before attempting to load modules

load_check_directory() doesn't return a pathname but a dict containing
a list of loaded (and failed-to-load) modules. Add the correct path so
that modules can be loaded properly

Closes-Bug: #1469085

Change-Id: Ib7f0b61044a012df2835af865667b77f917a9a63

subject: Add MaaS specific rabbitmq user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-06 20:53:09.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/playbooks/monitoring/raxmon_agent.yml', 'etc/rpc_deploy/user_variables.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/monitoring/maas_local.yml'], 'message': 'Add MaaS specific rabbitmq user

Since we are removing the guest/guest user from rabbitmq as part of
os-ad we need to create a maas specific user that has "administrator"
privileges, otherwise the monitors don't work.

This patch adds a maas_user to rabbit, with a password specified in
user_extras_secrets. This is then passed to the monitors for rabbit as
they are created.

Change-Id: Ia1218fbe064c7218af832660c4249f3afbeaafcc
Closes-Bug: #1466982
'}]
commit_message:
Add MaaS specific rabbitmq user

Since we are removing the guest/guest user from rabbitmq as part of
os-ad we need to create a maas specific user that has "administrator"
privileges, otherwise the monitors don't work.

This patch adds a maas_user to rabbit, with a password specified in
user_extras_secrets. This is then passed to the monitors for rabbit as
they are created.

Change-Id: Ia1218fbe064c7218af832660c4249f3afbeaafcc
Closes-Bug: #1466982

subject: Make sure we are returning floating IPs in current domain
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-29 23:11:45.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Make sure we are returning floating IPs in current domain

Make sure we are returning floating IPs in current domain when searching
for already allocated and available floating IPs.

When using a privileged user, Neutron returns all floating IPs allocated
in the cloud by default.
Nova just return floating IPs in current tenant.

This patch adds project_id parameter to
_neutron_available_floating_ips() to allow searching floating IPs in an
arbitrary tenant. If project_id is None, the current tenant id is used.

Change-Id: I4055e73ace8fa6653e154adf049ad423e976ecfe
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we are returning floating IPs in current domain

Make sure we are returning floating IPs in current domain when searching
for already allocated and available floating IPs.

When using a privileged user, Neutron returns all floating IPs allocated
in the cloud by default.
Nova just return floating IPs in current tenant.

This patch adds project_id parameter to
_neutron_available_floating_ips() to allow searching floating IPs in an
arbitrary tenant. If project_id is None, the current tenant id is used.

Change-Id: I4055e73ace8fa6653e154adf049ad423e976ecfe

commit_message:
Fix eventlet_server.Server TypeError

oslo.service >=0.2.0 will check if the launching service is an instance of
oslo_service.service.ServiceBase. A TypeError will be raised if not.
So changing eventlet_server.Server to inherit from it.

Change-Id: I128c422d1bcb84c1b1b40c996bb49074d218bd64
Closes-Bug: #1471045

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-05 19:03:22.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/api/test_driver_model.py', 'congress/tests/api/test_policy_model.py', 'congress/tests/api/test_row_model.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I09b3bec4c68c7fe9379b3d5fefbceaa86ffe994e
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I09b3bec4c68c7fe9379b3d5fefbceaa86ffe994e

subject: Clean up server launch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-06 07:40:13.000000000', 'files': ['congress/server/congress_server.py'], 'message': "Clean up server launch

Now we use oslo_service to launch Congress server,
systemd.notify_once() had been called in function wait()
of ServiceLauncher and ProcessLauncher, so we don't need
to call it in Congress launch logic.

Remove the useless loop in order to avoid to call
launcher.wait() in multiple times.

Change-Id: I23707ed873104116abeb5a96b2eb986bfc00e6a3
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up server launch

Now we use oslo_service to launch Congress server,
systemd.notify_once() had been called in function wait()
of ServiceLauncher and ProcessLauncher, so we don't need
to call it in Congress launch logic.

Remove the useless loop in order to avoid to call
launcher.wait() in multiple times.

Change-Id: I23707ed873104116abeb5a96b2eb986bfc00e6a3

commit_message:
Replace exception_to_str with oslo exception_to_unicode

oslo.utils 1.6 provides new method called exception_to_unicode which can
be used to replace our custom implementation of exception_to_str. As it
is always good habit to not reinvent the wheel - let's reuse it now.

The exception_to_unicode has been introduced it this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163507/4

Change-Id: I9d562cf92e1759082dab5984b0536b522834a18f

commit_message:
Do not call sys.exit inside ZanataUtils

ZanataUtils is a Python module, calling sys.exit() inside it is pretty
bad form, so stop doing it, and move the exit to create-zanata-xml.py.

Change-Id: I0662a5155ff31d37fd7a29e4d024d7279b17ff84

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-01 01:20:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-get-resp.json', 'doc/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-import-post-req.json', 'nova/tests/functional/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-import-post-req.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-post-resp.json.tpl', 'doc/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-import-post-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-list-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/api_sample_base.py', 'doc/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-post-req.json', 'doc/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-post-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/test_keypairs.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-post-req.json.tpl', 'doc/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-list-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-import-post-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-keypairs/keypairs-get-resp.json.tpl'], 'message': 'Merge V2 and V2.1 keypair functional tests

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges keypair functional tests.

Keypair has microversion v2.2. Their tests should not run for v2 code base.
So this commit also does the following to avoid running microversion tests
for v2:
- Override scenario in keypair v2.2 tests for microversion only not for v2 and v2.1
- Add logic in api_sample_base.py to run those tests on v2.1 code base.

Change-Id: Ifd39971625b035d817b2ccf0e5764682763acff9
'}]
commit_message:
Merge V2 and V2.1 keypair functional tests

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges keypair functional tests.

Keypair has microversion v2.2. Their tests should not run for v2 code base.
So this commit also does the following to avoid running microversion tests
for v2:
- Override scenario in keypair v2.2 tests for microversion only not for v2 and v2.1
- Add logic in api_sample_base.py to run those tests on v2.1 code base.

Change-Id: Ifd39971625b035d817b2ccf0e5764682763acff9

commit_message:
Fixes RabbitMQ guest user creation

This change removes the "guest" user. This patch fixes an issues
where the guest user was not being cared by default which could
leave a deployment vulnerable to should someone gain access to the
internal network that the messaging system runs within. To fix this
issue the guest user is simply being removed as its not needed by the
rest of the stack.

Closes-Bug: #1466982
Change-Id: I81f9295daf7923b828ad884b6707bb3f74b0684a
(cherry picked from commit 980938ab011ae773cd0e732f47b2d52d0afdcd9f)

commit_message:
Fixes RabbitMQ guest user creation

This change removes the "guest" user. This patch fixes an issues
where the guest user was not being cared by default which could
leave a deployment vulnerable to should someone gain access to the
internal network that the messaging system runs within. To fix this
issue the guest user is simply being removed as its not needed by the
rest of the stack.

Closes-Bug: #1466982
Change-Id: I81f9295daf7923b828ad884b6707bb3f74b0684a

Previously there were 4 python scripts being installed
into /usr/{local/}bin/ which contained the extension *.py.
There was also a developers script called barbican.sh
to create a developer's environment.

This change switches away from installing them as scripts,
preferring to use pbr's console_scripts entry point.  This
means that the scripts were moved to be part of a 'cmd'
module within the barbican module.

The barbican.sh script is also no longer installed as it
seems inappropriate to install this on consumers machines.

A few cosmetic changes were added to achieve pep8.

Change-Id: I452b56535ec18228060370be899af2a63d138472
Closes-Bug: 1454587
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Drop file extensions for /usr/bin/*

Previously there were 4 python scripts being installed
into /usr/{local/}bin/ which contained the extension *.py.
There was also a developers script called barbican.sh
to create a developer's environment.

This change switches away from installing them as scripts,
preferring to use pbr's console_scripts entry point.  This
means that the scripts were moved to be part of a 'cmd'
module within the barbican module.

The barbican.sh script is also no longer installed as it
seems inappropriate to install this on consumers machines.

A few cosmetic changes were added to achieve pep8.

Change-Id: I452b56535ec18228060370be899af2a63d138472
Closes-Bug: 1454587
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

commit_message:
Fixing hard-coded path

There are two places in angular launch-instance where it should have
used bathBase to build up a path rather than using hard-coded absolute
path (url). This bad practice keeps causing issues during refactoring.
This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I02e945c4f4793fe435a2f0942787928285c458b0

The Virtual I/O Server limits the name of a virtual optical device file
to 37 characters and that of a virtual disk backing file to 15
characters.  Recent pypowervm change set
Iea735799149e8d809e7bea020f3ee9e2497a17c3 implemented new constants for
these values as well as an optional parameter to the
sanitize_file_name_for_api utility.  This change set takes advantage of
that enhancement and implements length restrictions accordingly for
virtual disk and config ISO names.

Change-Id: Iad59d8e90eb41741872c067062bd0f9aaa16bb5c
'}]
commit_message:
Limit length of File object names

The Virtual I/O Server limits the name of a virtual optical device file
to 37 characters and that of a virtual disk backing file to 15
characters.  Recent pypowervm change set
Iea735799149e8d809e7bea020f3ee9e2497a17c3 implemented new constants for
these values as well as an optional parameter to the
sanitize_file_name_for_api utility.  This change set takes advantage of
that enhancement and implements length restrictions accordingly for
virtual disk and config ISO names.

Change-Id: Iad59d8e90eb41741872c067062bd0f9aaa16bb5c

commit_message:
Refactor DB creation

- Move DB creation for every service to own task
- Refactor Murano and Sahara DB configuration classes
- Cherry-pick MySQL providers from upstream to allow DB creation and
  management on remote host
- Remove openstack::db::mysql
- Move database and user creation to a separete task
- Either install local database or use an external one

Implements: blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ilyin <dilyin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Iaf3b7913e8c79c08025dbdaf5f2beff7337ab644
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
add worlddump at moments of success to compare in failures

We still have an intermittent connectivity problem in grenade, doing
dumps during normal runs at points of success might help us figure out
what went horribly wrong.

Change-Id: I835071d04d3fa463a9c710c80850ae35f40f7aa5

subject: remove swift-dsvm-functional from blocking changes to many projects
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-06 15:34:21.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "remove swift-dsvm-functional from blocking changes to many projects

This test is now at an extremely high fail rate, and is blocking
devstack, devstack-gate, keystone, and a set of other projects.

New functional tests have not been made blocking on projects they
aren't testing, so we should probably put swift functional tests into
that category as well.

Change-Id: Id436c0795d459ffc76571f1b87d378534c7e8229
"}]
commit_message:
remove swift-dsvm-functional from blocking changes to many projects

This test is now at an extremely high fail rate, and is blocking
devstack, devstack-gate, keystone, and a set of other projects.

New functional tests have not been made blocking on projects they
aren't testing, so we should probably put swift functional tests into
that category as well.

Change-Id: Id436c0795d459ffc76571f1b87d378534c7e8229

The list of properties for ImageMeta is determined by what

The list of properties for ImageMetaProps is based on what

commit_message:
objects: define the ImageMeta & ImageMetaProps objects

Defines two new object types to represent the data associated
with images from glance.

The list of properties for ImageMeta is determined by what
the Glance client API returns to Nova.

The list of properties for ImageMetaProps is based on what
is currently used by the various virt drivers. Many props
are renamed to ensure a consistent naming scheme across
drivers.

Co-Authored-By: Dennis Kliban <dkliban@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Blueprint: request-spec-object
Change-Id: I60162b8bae0aa44861bcbac5d215c49e8eda7c21

commit_message:
controller: enable HTTP Glance backend

While trying to download a glance image from a webserver, you need to
enable the HTTP backend store.
This patch aims to merge the configured backend and the HTTP store
backend so it will be enabled anytime.

Change-Id: Ie769831f8d491c1b7fe08b8fc7df9ebea493f9e8

Run as root for killing haproxy

Neutron user is not permitted to kill nobody's haproxy daemon.

Change-Id: I7f31f98a61a2058499edded008a2af4f3d40effb
Closes-Bug: #1464565

commit_message:
Change default digest_algorithm value to sha256

In I9236cc85f4e9881ac1aa35d69bc6761a59c1b6c8 it was promised that the
default for digest_algorithm would change from sha1 to sha256. The sole
purpose of this commit is to upgrade the default to sha256 as promised.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact
Change-Id: I12be91db7b86e335a84c9ebed86dac3ba09051cb

subject: Use module install script for acceptance tests
revisions:
[{'number': 43, 'created': '2015-07-03 18:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'message': "Use module install script for acceptance tests

This patch updates the spec_helper_acceptance.rb file to use the common
module install script and Puppetfile from the new
openstack/puppet-openstack-integration repo. This will allow us to take
advantage of Zuul's Depends-On feature so that we can test changes
across multiple related modules. This is based on idea 1 from this
brainstorming session[1].

Removes the purging of the modules directory since r10k does that for
us.

This will probably be abstracted out into a separate function or
eventually a separate gem so that it can be more easily shared across
the OpenStack modules and the Infra modules.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/puppet-git-dependencies

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Spencer Krum <spencer.krum@hp.com>
Change-Id: I0f63df75fd1a206af7452b239840fd466e6ec080
Depends-On: Ide59ef4bdf53a04957e3593815b7514a0e744e0e
"}]
commit_message:
Use module install script for acceptance tests

This patch updates the spec_helper_acceptance.rb file to use the common
module install script and Puppetfile from the new
openstack/puppet-openstack-integration repo. This will allow us to take
advantage of Zuul's Depends-On feature so that we can test changes
across multiple related modules. This is based on idea 1 from this
brainstorming session[1].

Removes the purging of the modules directory since r10k does that for
us.

This will probably be abstracted out into a separate function or
eventually a separate gem so that it can be more easily shared across
the OpenStack modules and the Infra modules.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/puppet-git-dependencies

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Spencer Krum <spencer.krum@hp.com>
Change-Id: I0f63df75fd1a206af7452b239840fd466e6ec080
Depends-On: Ide59ef4bdf53a04957e3593815b7514a0e744e0e

subject: Added a 'NAME' attribute to define names of classes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 12:05:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Added a 'NAME' attribute to define names of classes

The need to redefine the typenames of versioned object is a common
usecase, which may be required either to make object name differ from
the python's classname or to give a same name to two different types to
indicates their duck-type compatibility.

The existing way of doing this is to override obj_name() classmethod of
VersionedObject class to return a needed string constant instead of
cls.__name__. However, such an override has a bad sideeffect: all the
descendants of such a class will have the same string constant as their
names as well, while this is most probably not needed.

This patch adds an alternative way to define the type name of the
versioned object: adding a 'NAME' attribute to appropriate class.
This attribute is used to compute the obj_name value, but only if the
attribute is defined at this particular class (i.e. is not inherited
from base).

The old way of overriding the obj_name() is still available for
backwards compatibility purposes but is not recommended for usage unless
it is required to have all the descendants to have the same obj_name
with their parent.

Change-Id: I4973aec459cdd49972b062132d0367e853b33caa
"}]
commit_message:
Added a 'NAME' attribute to define names of classes

The need to redefine the typenames of versioned object is a common
usecase, which may be required either to make object name differ from
the python's classname or to give a same name to two different types to
indicates their duck-type compatibility.

The existing way of doing this is to override obj_name() classmethod of
VersionedObject class to return a needed string constant instead of
cls.__name__. However, such an override has a bad sideeffect: all the
descendants of such a class will have the same string constant as their
names as well, while this is most probably not needed.

This patch adds an alternative way to define the type name of the
versioned object: adding a 'NAME' attribute to appropriate class.
This attribute is used to compute the obj_name value, but only if the
attribute is defined at this particular class (i.e. is not inherited
from base).

The old way of overriding the obj_name() is still available for
backwards compatibility purposes but is not recommended for usage unless
it is required to have all the descendants to have the same obj_name
with their parent.

Change-Id: I4973aec459cdd49972b062132d0367e853b33caa

commit_message:
Add search_opts into the method list() for qos specs

ManagerWithFind.findall require  search_opts for all tenants support,
the parameter search_opts should also be in all manager classes, which
use find method, qos spec does't have this parameter for list().
This change add it.

Change-Id: Iea619d66d217d92047a5b965d1e375acc97fa65b
Related-Bug: #1252665

Initial PowerVM Package Structure

Provides the initial package structure for inclusion of the PowerVM
compute inspector.  Also includes a fixture for upcoming unit tests.
Implementation of the inspector functions are to be included in upcoming
change sets.

Partially Implements: blueprint powervm-compute-inspector

Change-Id: Idb56336bf51edcfbe4f400b10e6f4e6935af450b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-30 17:36:25.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add pypowervm to global requirements

The API to interact with PowerVM is the open-source pypowervm library.
Multiple projects require use of the API as PowerVM hypervisor support
is being added to various projects.

The impacted projects are:
- Nova: StackForge project initially.  Proposal for core integration in
  an upcoming release.
- Neutron: Decomposed ML2 Agent
- Ceilometer: Core support

This change adds pypowervm to the global-requirements so that the other
projects can make use of the API.

The version of pypowervm being added supports both Python 2.7 and 3.4.

The API can be found at https://github.com/pypowervm/pypowervm

Change-Id: I6174b613ed12228315c85608c95a1df8dea7a714
'}]
commit_message:
Add pypowervm to global requirements

The API to interact with PowerVM is the open-source pypowervm library.
Multiple projects require use of the API as PowerVM hypervisor support
is being added to various projects.

The impacted projects are:
- Nova: StackForge project initially.  Proposal for core integration in
  an upcoming release.
- Neutron: Decomposed ML2 Agent
- Ceilometer: Core support

This change adds pypowervm to the global-requirements so that the other
projects can make use of the API.

The version of pypowervm being added supports both Python 2.7 and 3.4.

The API can be found at https://github.com/pypowervm/pypowervm

Change-Id: I6174b613ed12228315c85608c95a1df8dea7a714

commit_message:
Make current mariadb container use start.sh

This container was using mysql-entrypoint.sh and a separate config
script. These have been merged into start.sh, as is used in other
containers. After this it will be easier to move to
config-internal/config-external configs.

Some code that was never used has been removed (there are no
MARIADB_PASSWORD, MARIADB_USER or MARIADB_DATABASE variables).

Change-Id: Idd3358421d1ebec10e26e54bde7c7747ddaadf9b
Closes-bug: #1471589

Synchronizing session on delete leads to traces in neutron-server
logs when such binding is deleted concurrently.
Also, catch and ignore ObjectDeletedError during iterating over
bindings, that is possible since the code is not within a transaction.

Change-Id: I7a2c9a8a59ce313c7d242230eeb5da69986bfbd4
Closes-Bug: #1424593
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid synchronizing session when deleting networkdhcpagentbinding

Synchronizing session on delete leads to traces in neutron-server
logs when such binding is deleted concurrently.
Also, catch and ignore ObjectDeletedError during iterating over
bindings, that is possible since the code is not within a transaction.

Change-Id: I7a2c9a8a59ce313c7d242230eeb5da69986bfbd4
Closes-Bug: #1424593

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-27 20:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['network/ports/vip.yaml'], 'message': "Add ControlPlaneNetwork to vip.yaml

There are two files in network/ports which control the VIP
behavior called ctlplane_vip.yaml and vip.yaml. One of these
files was missing ControlPlaneNetwork, since it wasn't used
inside the template. Unfortunately, tuskar chokes on this,
even though Heat can build the stack just fine. This change
makes the vip.yaml and ctlplane_vip.yaml equivalent by adding

Change-Id: Ic20281e58a1130afe18d5aec505a3df199841fd5

commit_message:
Add ControlPlaneNetwork to vip.yaml

There are two files in network/ports which control the VIP
behavior called ctlplane_vip.yaml and vip.yaml. One of these
files was missing ControlPlaneNetwork, since it wasn't used
inside the template. Unfortunately, tuskar chokes on this,
even though Heat can build the stack just fine. This change
makes the vip.yaml and ctlplane_vip.yaml equivalent by adding
ControlPlaneNetwork to the vip.yaml template.

Change-Id: Ic20281e58a1130afe18d5aec505a3df199841fd5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-06 15:32:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/process.rst'], 'message': 'Use Code-Review to Freeze instead of Workflow

Let's use Code-Review -2 to Freeze instead of Workflow -1. The
semantics are better "Do not merge" vs "Work in progress" and
it's easier to filter the frozen guidelines vs those that are
actually a work in progress.

Change-Id: Ib030bcdfd5e90766a5a22ca84c86dc59ef30cdb5
'}]
commit_message:
Use Code-Review to Freeze instead of Workflow

Let's use Code-Review -2 to Freeze instead of Workflow -1. The
semantics are better "Do not merge" vs "Work in progress" and
it's easier to filter the frozen guidelines vs those that are
actually a work in progress.

Change-Id: Ib030bcdfd5e90766a5a22ca84c86dc59ef30cdb5

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-03 00:30:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/test_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Catch broad exception in methods used in FixedIntervalLoopingCall

Unlike other places where it might make sense to catch specific
exceptions, methods that are used to check L3 and DHCP agents
liveness via FixedIntervalLoopingCall should never allow exceptions
to leak to calling method and interrupt the loop.

Further improvement of FixedIntervalLoopingCall might be needed,
but for the sake of easy backporting it makes sense to fix the issue
in neutron before pushing refactoring to 3rd-party library.

Change-Id: I6a61e99a6f4e445e26ea4a9923b47e35559e5703
Closes-Bug: #1458119
'}]
commit_message:
Catch broad exception in methods used in FixedIntervalLoopingCall

Unlike other places where it might make sense to catch specific
exceptions, methods that are used to check L3 and DHCP agents
liveness via FixedIntervalLoopingCall should never allow exceptions
to leak to calling method and interrupt the loop.

Further improvement of FixedIntervalLoopingCall might be needed,
but for the sake of easy backporting it makes sense to fix the issue
in neutron before pushing refactoring to 3rd-party library.

Change-Id: I6a61e99a6f4e445e26ea4a9923b47e35559e5703
Closes-Bug: #1458119

Renames 'index' entrypoint (and cmd) to 'manage', and adds a command
'index' whose current only subcommand is 'sync' (with the intent that
we'll add more, like testing how in-sync things are).

Adds an entry point 'listener' for the notification listener, and

commit_message:
Tidy up searchlight entry points

Renames 'index' entrypoint (and cmd) to 'manage', and adds a command
'index' whose current only subcommand is 'sync' (with the intent that
we'll add more, like testing how in-sync things are).

Adds an entry point 'listener' for the notification listener, and
renames that cmd to 'listener'.

Change-Id: I24a1d1d5422081973746f2fe11c22c106c2c18af
Implements: rename-entrypoints

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-06 12:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json'], 'message': 'Bump puppetlabs-rabbitmq version

No API changes related to our use of the puppetlabs-rabbitmq module
have occured and we are testing using the latest version of
puppetlabs-rabbitmq. This patch increases the upper bound on the
dependency on the puppetlabs-rabbitmq module.

Change-Id: I1702439b6f8a388347a62b08874623c260619705
'}]
commit_message:
Bump puppetlabs-rabbitmq version

No API changes related to our use of the puppetlabs-rabbitmq module
have occured and we are testing using the latest version of
puppetlabs-rabbitmq. This patch increases the upper bound on the
dependency on the puppetlabs-rabbitmq module.

Change-Id: I1702439b6f8a388347a62b08874623c260619705

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-03 13:09:52.000000000', 'files': ['bin/agent'], 'message': "Gather available offloading modes

Gather available offloading modes for physical interfaces
during the bootstrap stage. In this commit 'ethtool' util
output parsing approach has been used. Nailgun agent
collects modes and sent it to the nailgun API. These modes
will be parsed via nailgun and will be put into
offloading_modes JSON field of the interface db model.

Change-Id: Ic58abf4e4da30e6fd7320dd385c9ddee74057ee1
Implements: blueprint selectable-offloading-type
"}]
commit_message:
Gather available offloading modes

Gather available offloading modes for physical interfaces
during the bootstrap stage. In this commit 'ethtool' util
output parsing approach has been used. Nailgun agent
collects modes and sent it to the nailgun API. These modes
will be parsed via nailgun and will be put into
offloading_modes JSON field of the interface db model.

Change-Id: Ic58abf4e4da30e6fd7320dd385c9ddee74057ee1
Implements: blueprint selectable-offloading-type

commit_message:
QoS extension fixes

This patch introduces small fixes to the QoS extensions:
1. Adding a common tenant_id field for QoS API calls.
2. Making sure the function interface is correct.

Co-Authored-By: Irena Berezovsky <irenab.dev@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If9c7a7b9b8a5d2367d8f3225fbf07d8e3ec8865d

[{'number': 27, 'created': '2015-07-03 08:04:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_consoles.py', 'doc/api_samples/versions/versions-get-resp.json', 'nova/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/v2.6/create-vnc-console-resp.json.tpl', 'doc/v3/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/v2.6/create-vnc-console-resp.json', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_versions.py', 'doc/v3/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/v2.6/create-vnc-console-req.json', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/remote_consoles.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/remote_consoles.py', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/v2.6/create-vnc-console-req.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/test_remote_consoles.py', 'nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/versions/versions-get-resp.json.tpl'], 'message': 'Consolidate the APIs for getting consoles

A new API is added with microversion 2.6:

POST /servers/<uuid>/remote-consoles
{
  "remote_console": {
    "protocol": ["vnc"|"rdp"|"serial"|"spice"],
    "type": ["novnc"|"xpvnc"|"rdp-html5"|"spice-html5"|"serial"]
  }
}

which supports all protocols and types for remote consoles.

Implements: blueprint consolidate-console-api

APIImpact

Change-Id: I175a778cede8fbeee9c47a502ab7a98f6d73c074
'}]

commit_message:
Add stubs for mysql module

  We need these stubs in order to avoid pathcing upstream
  puppet openstack modules while updating them for Kilo.

  Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: I495ff6168c5f60582e5f17a99faf8966011ca5d7

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-06 12:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['utils/jenkins/modules.disable_rake-lint', 'deployment/puppet/apache/.puppet-lint.rc', 'utils/jenkins/fuel_syntax_check.sh'], 'message': "Improve and fix syntax checks

- Added some parameters to syntax check script in order to allow
  users to run tests against specific/all modules.
- Fixed $GEM_HOME var, it should not be set script-wide, since it
  breaks test executed via puppet-lint utility. We should set
  $GEM_HOME only for 'bundle' commands.
- Added possibility to disable 'rake lint' checks for modules with
  broken tests. Such modules will be tested with 'puppet-lint'
  utility.
- Updated .puppet-lint.rc for Apache module to support older
  versions of puppet-lint.

DocImpact: From now it's possible to run syntax check script for
some specific modules using '--module PATH_TO_MODULE' option, or
test all the modules at once using '--all'.
If you want to disable 'rake lint' test for some module, please
add such module name to './utils/jenkins/modules.disable_rake-lint'

Fuel-CI: disable
Closes-bug: #1471198
Change-Id: Ibdd609be303cc8f60451b09a729e68b1472528a5
"}]
commit_message:
Improve and fix syntax checks

- Added some parameters to syntax check script in order to allow
  users to run tests against specific/all modules.
- Fixed $GEM_HOME var, it should not be set script-wide, since it
  breaks test executed via puppet-lint utility. We should set
  $GEM_HOME only for 'bundle' commands.
- Added possibility to disable 'rake lint' checks for modules with
  broken tests. Such modules will be tested with 'puppet-lint'
  utility.
- Updated .puppet-lint.rc for Apache module to support older
  versions of puppet-lint.

DocImpact: From now it's possible to run syntax check script for
some specific modules using '--module PATH_TO_MODULE' option, or
test all the modules at once using '--all'.
If you want to disable 'rake lint' test for some module, please
add such module name to './utils/jenkins/modules.disable_rake-lint'

Fuel-CI: disable
Closes-bug: #1471198
Change-Id: Ibdd609be303cc8f60451b09a729e68b1472528a5

subject: Change template to match our historic usage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-02 12:49:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/template.rst'], 'message': "Change template to match our historic usage

The template had the assumption that each guideline would get its own
file. The downside of this is that it would make our table of contents
hard to navigate. I propose that each file should be a collection of
related guidelines and each guideline should be a subheader within the
file.

It's still easy to link to specific guidelines with anchor links to
subheaders.

Change-Id: I6ac1587fe28cbc815dffb8d0e1dcc14f006107fa
"}]
commit_message:
Change template to match our historic usage

The template had the assumption that each guideline would get its own
file. The downside of this is that it would make our table of contents
hard to navigate. I propose that each file should be a collection of
related guidelines and each guideline should be a subheader within the
file.

It's still easy to link to specific guidelines with anchor links to
subheaders.

Change-Id: I6ac1587fe28cbc815dffb8d0e1dcc14f006107fa

commit_message:
Catch a connection refused exception not to show traces

If deployment has wrong URL, the output of 'rally deployment show'
was traced. Changed to catch a connection refused exception and not
to trace. Print user friendly message instead of trace message.
Added 'get' method to get deployment object and 'service_list'
method to get service list of keystone client object in api.

Co-Authored-By: Kun Huang <gareth@openstacker.org>
Change-Id: I4e5e75f73f1e408a3568b3800f6ce076c59cf2ba
Closes-Bug: #1407824

subject: Fixed the upgrade script edge case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 18:12:14.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Fixed the upgrade script edge case

Changed the command to find the containers to only look for the contianer
config file within a given directory and to only look one level deep.
This change is in response to an issue that can happen if the container
directory "/var/lib/lxc" is also a mounted file system.

Change-Id: Id39995580900e2b9d9a35435d0cfeba82075d62b
Closes-Bug: #1470571
(cherry picked from commit 3e0e848181b4fe4ace48d773f3113ef111227519)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the upgrade script edge case

Changed the command to find the containers to only look for the contianer
config file within a given directory and to only look one level deep.
This change is in response to an issue that can happen if the container
directory "/var/lib/lxc" is also a mounted file system.

Change-Id: Id39995580900e2b9d9a35435d0cfeba82075d62b
Closes-Bug: #1470571
(cherry picked from commit 3e0e848181b4fe4ace48d773f3113ef111227519)

commit_message:
libvirt: handle code=38 + sigkill (ebusy) in destroy()

Handle the libvirt error during destroy when the sigkill fails due to an
EBUSY. This is taken from a comment by danpb in the bug report as a
potential workaround.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Berrange (berrange@redhat.com)

Closes-Bug: #1353939

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

    NOTE (kashyapc): 'stable/kilo' branch doesn't have the
    'libvirt_guest' object, so, adjust the below unit tests accordingly:

        test_private_destroy_ebusy_timeout
        test_private_destroy_ebusy_multiple_attempt_ok

Change-Id: I128bf6b939fbbc85df521fd3fe23c3c6f93b1b2c

commit_message:
Use OCC Environment Variable Configuration

Use the OCC feature to get the configuration for the OS_*
environment variables.  Command line options should not be
defaulted to environment variables so we can tell the difference
between what has been specified in the environment and what has
been overridden by a command line option.

Change-Id: I42c64cf08af59f94e93e16cbbd7d88a261ca1675

commit_message:
Tighten permissions on /etc/ironic

/etc/ironic/ironic.conf contains passwords, but is left
world readable.  Changed that file to be readable only
by the ironic user, and for good measure set the directory
and files under /etc/ironic to be owned by ironic:ironic.

Change-Id: I85df0d448e3908ea44b0adf098aa56e92903196b

subject: Make tools/min-env.sh portable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-05 00:08:48.000000000', 'files': ['tools/min-env.sh'], 'message': "Make tools/min-env.sh portable

We had different issues here.

First, sort command used to sort variables and services names is
dependent on the local, so fix it to C to have consistent
results. C local is available on all systems.

Second, awk doesn't recognize \s escape char for space on OSX. This
resulted in indented check_required_vars calls being ignored. In fact,
all variables checked via indented check_required_vars calls (i.e. in
a fuction or conditional block) are actually *optional* variables, so
I changed the behavior to ignore those.

Change-Id: I6fc4cca9567cb712609d0fe0a20dfe21ed6df151
Closes-Bug: #1470683
"}]
commit_message:
Make tools/min-env.sh portable

We had different issues here.

First, sort command used to sort variables and services names is
dependent on the local, so fix it to C to have consistent
results. C local is available on all systems.

Second, awk doesn't recognize \s escape char for space on OSX. This
resulted in indented check_required_vars calls being ignored. In fact,
all variables checked via indented check_required_vars calls (i.e. in
a fuction or conditional block) are actually *optional* variables, so
I changed the behavior to ignore those.

Change-Id: I6fc4cca9567cb712609d0fe0a20dfe21ed6df151
Closes-Bug: #1470683

commit_message:
Remove nonexistent LIO terminate_connection call

Commit 9c0a64f3d7153bc262ce4fa0280a895992a9994f introduced a call to
LIO's target helper method terminate_connection but such method does not
exist in Juno.

This patch removes method terminate_connection from LVMISCSIDriver (the
one that was calling target's terminate_connection).  This way parent
class ISCSIDriver's terminate_connection will be called as it was before.

Alternative would be backporting commit
641a44eb17a8de53e54f09a2dc339129d41c529f.

Change-Id: I80f0784b7718aff1feea4db19602616f0dfed8c5
Closes-bug: #1470146

commit_message:
Use underscores instead of dashes as word separators in API resource names

Change project-quotas and project-id to project_quotas and project_id.

To be consistent with the OpenStack API WG recommendations: we should
use dashes in the resource names (the request URLs) and use underscores
in the field names (the JSON response).

Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources

Change-Id: Icebf327c3c3b52afb0f847d6ab626e6d8eda12aa

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 6772, 'name': 'Stephen Gordon', 'email': 'sgordon@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgordon'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 9060, 'name': 'Mike Dorman', 'email': 'dorm@dorm.org', 'username': 'gd-mdorman'}, {'_account_id': 9444, 'name': 'gustavo panizzo', 'email': 'gfa@zumbi.com.ar', 'username': 'gfa'}, {'_account_id': 11303, 'name': 'Markus Zoeller (markus_z)', 'email': 'mzoeller@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'mzoeller'}, {'_account_id': 11647, 'name': 'Przemyslaw Czesnowicz', 'email': 'przemyslaw.czesnowicz@intel.com', 'username': 'pczesno'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 16:22:09.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/libvirt-log-file-and-serial-console.rst'], 'message': 'libvirt: use "serial console" and "log file" in parallel

The "serial console" feature was introduced as a means for connecting
to an instance without having network access. From a user perspective
it goes a similar direction like VNC, SPICE and RDP connections.
As an implementation decision, a user could EITHER use the log file
OR the serial console. The intention of this blueprint is to enable
libvirt guests to have

* a log file
* AND a serial console

in parallel.

Blueprint: libvirt-log-file-and-serial-console
Change-Id: Ifdb93bd99d745140c0242843d35a38bc6c2a23b3
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: use "serial console" and "log file" in parallel

The "serial console" feature was introduced as a means for connecting
to an instance without having network access. From a user perspective
it goes a similar direction like VNC, SPICE and RDP connections.
As an implementation decision, a user could EITHER use the log file
OR the serial console. The intention of this blueprint is to enable
libvirt guests to have

* a log file
* AND a serial console

in parallel.

Blueprint: libvirt-log-file-and-serial-console
Change-Id: Ifdb93bd99d745140c0242843d35a38bc6c2a23b3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 17:00:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipmitool.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py'], 'message': 'Validate IPMI protocol version for IPMIShellinaboxConsole

Serial over lan using ipmitool only works with IPMI protocol version
2.0 (-I lanplus). This patch is adding a check in the validate() to
catch that.

This patch also adds missing tests for the validate() method of that

Related-Bug: #1468378
Change-Id: Ib4baa360adb45c6dd8b9c923cacadace6e693b91
'}]
commit_message:
Validate IPMI protocol version for IPMIShellinaboxConsole

Serial over lan using ipmitool only works with IPMI protocol version
2.0 (-I lanplus). This patch is adding a check in the validate() to
catch that.

This patch also adds missing tests for the validate() method of that
class.

Related-Bug: #1468378
Change-Id: Ib4baa360adb45c6dd8b9c923cacadace6e693b91

commit_message:
Add missing tenant_id to lbaas-v2 resources creation

Now tenant_id is not specific when creating lbaas v2 loadbalancer, listener,
pool, member. This patch add missing tenant_id to lbaas-v2 resources
creation. So admin user can create resource for specific project.

Change-Id: If4db4d8660354bc1f4d5259ebed73d78b4cfcd97
Closes-Bug: #1453706
(cherry picked from commit d5360202e16b635eac907fe1f30bf387b39e238d)

commit_message:
Added support to pools and flavors

Python-zaqarclient had missing features for v1.1 which involved pools and flavors that
needed to be added.

I added support to pools by adding a 'pool_update' and a 'pool_list' function,
and add support to flavors by writing a 'flavor_update' and a 'flavor_list'
function.

Change-Id: I640d17c64be6448283c53ae0dbea6543484ff7a4
Depends-on: I36445838f532e9f282a4f839a0f583257c1f13d9
Partially-implements: # blueprint api-v1.1

commit_message:
Make max_header_line configurable

Nova and other services can be set max_header_line in their config file.
But for keystone, max_header_line is hardcoded.
This commit make max_header_line configurable.

Change-Id: Ie97536b5d0584adb4338e8f727c756d0772cf443
Closes-Bug: #1433194

'}]
commit_message:
Use NIDs instead of strings

This makes code more explicit, cuts down things we need to test and may
potentially prevent some security issues for text/nid ambiguity.

The change also removes some possible failure modes and cuts down the
number of needed unit tests.

Closes-bug: 1464435
Change-Id: I18723d8498d1e5443873f561406c3452024278b5

The driver is based on the iptables firewall.
It is a beta-version for POC purpose and not yet implements log action.

To use it, you need to have in the 'securitygroup' section:

enable_security_group = true
enable_extended_security_group = true
firewall_driver =
neutron.agent.linux.iptables_bf_firewall.IptablesBfFirewallDriver

Change-Id: I8265abc96f70d2f5afabc0dcd1669cfb09c75f95
Partial-Implements: blueprint security-group-brute-force-prevention

commit_message:
Add rate limit iptables security group firewall.

The driver is based on the iptables firewall.
It is a beta-version for POC purpose and not yet implements log action.

To use it, you need to have in the 'securitygroup' section:

enable_security_group = true
enable_extended_security_group = true
firewall_driver =
neutron.agent.linux.iptables_bf_firewall.IptablesBfFirewallDriver

Change-Id: I8265abc96f70d2f5afabc0dcd1669cfb09c75f95
Partial-Implements: blueprint security-group-brute-force-prevention

subnet ID in loadbalancer pool will not be reset.
Now an error message will be thrown and subnet will not be allowed to

Related-Bug: #1413817

Change-Id: Icf3ab9c039a597a50d462cd61b79bc397f353bc5
'}]
commit_message:
When an subnet which is attached with loadbalancer is deleted, the
subnet ID in loadbalancer pool will not be reset.
Now an error message will be thrown and subnet will not be allowed to
delete until it is disassociated from loadbalancer pool.

Related-Bug: #1413817

Change-Id: Icf3ab9c039a597a50d462cd61b79bc397f353bc5

subject: Add parent resource support to neutronclient command extension
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 23:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/v2_0/client.py'], 'message': 'Add parent resource support to neutronclient command extension

neutronV20.find_resourceid_by_name_or_id() accepts parent_id as
one of its parameter. With the new extension mechanism, parent_id
is not usable, as the generic extend_list() does not take
parent_id as parameter. With this change, the class using the
extension mechanism has to specify its parent resource name as
"parent_resource=<resource_name>". When the class is loaded by
neutronclient it checks for the "parent_resource" attribute and
uses it accordingly in extend_list().

Change-Id: I7abd540f5b81b08b3dd4de359597f95da29e652d
Closes-Bug: 1446428
'}]
commit_message:
Add parent resource support to neutronclient command extension

neutronV20.find_resourceid_by_name_or_id() accepts parent_id as
one of its parameter. With the new extension mechanism, parent_id
is not usable, as the generic extend_list() does not take
parent_id as parameter. With this change, the class using the
extension mechanism has to specify its parent resource name as
"parent_resource=<resource_name>". When the class is loaded by
neutronclient it checks for the "parent_resource" attribute and
uses it accordingly in extend_list().

Change-Id: I7abd540f5b81b08b3dd4de359597f95da29e652d
Closes-Bug: 1446428

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-08 09:50:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Add non-isolated network metadata server route

In some images routes may be pre-existing for the 169.254.0.0/16
network which makes the metadata server unreachable. This fix adds a
route to the metadata server IP setting the gateway IP as next hop
that makes the metadata server accessible even if a custom local
route is present.

Closes-bug 1426305
Change-Id: Id36768822a0a7d72746160663e941269420a0b74
'}]
commit_message:
Add non-isolated network metadata server route

In some images routes may be pre-existing for the 169.254.0.0/16
network which makes the metadata server unreachable. This fix adds a
route to the metadata server IP setting the gateway IP as next hop
that makes the metadata server accessible even if a custom local
route is present.

Closes-bug 1426305
Change-Id: Id36768822a0a7d72746160663e941269420a0b74

subject: Make it easier to use the eventlet backdoor locally
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-30 18:03:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/tests/test_eventlet_backdoor.py', 'oslo_service/eventlet_backdoor.py', 'oslo_service/tests/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Make it easier to use the eventlet backdoor locally

In order to determine what to do about this module it
is quite useful to provide for a way to run it as its own
main program (and interact with it from another telnet
session).

This adds a simple `main` function and uses it.

This can then be used like:

$ python oslo_service/eventlet_backdoor.py --backdoor_port 8000

Then from another terminal:

$ telnet localhost 8000

Change-Id: I8c2b93dfad328929e1a106c5883903fe0bfb188a
'}]
commit_message:
Make it easier to use the eventlet backdoor locally

In order to determine what to do about this module it
is quite useful to provide for a way to run it as its own
main program (and interact with it from another telnet
session).

This adds a simple `main` function and uses it.

This can then be used like:

$ python oslo_service/eventlet_backdoor.py --backdoor_port 8000

Then from another terminal:

$ telnet localhost 8000

Change-Id: I8c2b93dfad328929e1a106c5883903fe0bfb188a

commit_message:
Remove "JSON" from sevice clients' names

Current modules of service clients contain "JSON" in these names
but we need to remove them. Because current service clients supports
JSON only and "JSON" in these names are meaningless now.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ic6d4c340e145a18cd45bc6fe750e9fdc8c5d2a8d

commit_message:
Add cliff based common cli entrypoint

This commit adds the basic framework to tempest for a unified modular
CLI endpoint using cliff. As of right now this entry-point doesn't
really do anything but exist. It will be expanded in the future first
all the existing commands will be refactored to be used through this.
Secondly a new interface and workflow for running tempest will be
created on top of this.

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Treinish <mtreinish@kortar.org>

Change-Id: I1ff8d22c120dbc81d812f1f107db7c2d9b15a505
Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-improvements

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-16 05:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Detach volume after deleting instance with no host

If an instance is booted from a volume, shelved, and goes into an error
state due to some reason. Volume from which instance is booted, remains
in-use state even the instance is deleted because instance has no host
associated with it.

Called _local_delete() to detach volume and destroy bdm if instance is
in shelved_offloaded state or has no host associated with it. This will
cleanup both volumes and the networks.

Currently in test_servers.py, "test_delete_server_instance" executes
similar to "test_delete_server_instance_while_building". This is because
"test_delete_server_instance" calls instance.save() method which updates
vm_state to building where it should be in active state.

Fixed "test_delete_server_instance" to test deleting an instance which
is in active state and has a valid host.

Closes-Bug: #1404867
Closes-Bug: #1408527
Change-Id: Ic630ae7d026a9697afec46ac9ea40aea0f5b5ffb
(cherry picked from commit d1baa9fe7eb342b63fc85cbb5ef70bb676de6566)
'}]
commit_message:
Detach volume after deleting instance with no host

If an instance is booted from a volume, shelved, and goes into an error
state due to some reason. Volume from which instance is booted, remains
in-use state even the instance is deleted because instance has no host
associated with it.

Called _local_delete() to detach volume and destroy bdm if instance is
in shelved_offloaded state or has no host associated with it. This will
cleanup both volumes and the networks.

Currently in test_servers.py, "test_delete_server_instance" executes
similar to "test_delete_server_instance_while_building". This is because
"test_delete_server_instance" calls instance.save() method which updates
vm_state to building where it should be in active state.

Fixed "test_delete_server_instance" to test deleting an instance which
is in active state and has a valid host.

Closes-Bug: #1404867
Closes-Bug: #1408527
Change-Id: Ic630ae7d026a9697afec46ac9ea40aea0f5b5ffb
(cherry picked from commit d1baa9fe7eb342b63fc85cbb5ef70bb676de6566)

subject: Retry volume detach on DiskNotFound
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 15:50:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'requirements.txt', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Retry volume detach on DiskNotFound

When starting/restarting/rebuilding instances, it may happen that a
volume detach request comes right in the middle of attaching a volume
in the driver. In this case the hypervisor (e.g. libvirt) will throw
DiskNotFound exception in driver.detach_volume() call, but still
the volume gets attached eventually, when the instance starts.

This leaves the instance in the state, when the volume is `de-facto`
attached to it (i.e. shown in the `virsh dumpxmp $instance` output
for libvirt), but both Nova and Cinder think the volume is actually
*not* in-use.

The proposed solution is to give the hypervisor a chance to detach
the volume again when handling DiskNotFound exception as it must be
attached from what we know from the state of Cinder/Nova databases.

Closes-Bug: #1471271

Change-Id: I34dd207aa5de86b9f58b01fc6949692f6f9b64f2
'}]
commit_message:
Retry volume detach on DiskNotFound

When starting/restarting/rebuilding instances, it may happen that a
volume detach request comes right in the middle of attaching a volume
in the driver. In this case the hypervisor (e.g. libvirt) will throw
DiskNotFound exception in driver.detach_volume() call, but still
the volume gets attached eventually, when the instance starts.

This leaves the instance in the state, when the volume is `de-facto`
attached to it (i.e. shown in the `virsh dumpxmp $instance` output
for libvirt), but both Nova and Cinder think the volume is actually
*not* in-use.

The proposed solution is to give the hypervisor a chance to detach
the volume again when handling DiskNotFound exception as it must be
attached from what we know from the state of Cinder/Nova databases.

Closes-Bug: #1471271

Change-Id: I34dd207aa5de86b9f58b01fc6949692f6f9b64f2

commit_message:

subject: Add IP to HAProxy kind=Optional constraint
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-03 06:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Add IP to HAProxy kind=Optional constraint

Without the constraint the VIP could get assigned to a node without
an active haproxy instance, which ultimately means everything stops
working.

kind=Optional allows a VIP to relocate to a healthy haproxy instance
in the event of a failure without tearing down the entire stack in the
process.

Change-Id: I44d44952fb42cf91a2a248250a4063e3034d119e
'}]
commit_message:
Add IP to HAProxy kind=Optional constraint

Without the constraint the VIP could get assigned to a node without
an active haproxy instance, which ultimately means everything stops
working.

kind=Optional allows a VIP to relocate to a healthy haproxy instance
in the event of a failure without tearing down the entire stack in the
process.

Change-Id: I44d44952fb42cf91a2a248250a4063e3034d119e

subject: Remove unwanted constraints between the Redis vip and Ceilometer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Remove unwanted constraints between the Redis vip and Ceilometer

We do not want to delay Redis vip start to promotion of Redis master,
HAProxy will take care of the validating the backends.

We do not need to force colocation of Redis vip with Redis master.

We do not want to restart the Ceilometer central agent when the vip
moves this can instead cause unwanted cascading restarts due to other
constraints in between services.

More details can be read on the BZ at:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1236374

Change-Id: I594984cd23db7de57746c3e1018181d61b020f46
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unwanted constraints between the Redis vip and Ceilometer

We do not want to delay Redis vip start to promotion of Redis master,
HAProxy will take care of the validating the backends.

We do not need to force colocation of Redis vip with Redis master.

We do not want to restart the Ceilometer central agent when the vip
moves this can instead cause unwanted cascading restarts due to other
constraints in between services.

More details can be read on the BZ at:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1236374

Change-Id: I594984cd23db7de57746c3e1018181d61b020f46

Change-Id: I91f13da740bf1e66dffd68cdf666a24d68aa543d
Closes-Bug: #1471650

commit_message:
Fix TypeError when call keystoneclient session.request()

A TypeError raised when run cmd 'heat resource-show':
 TypeError: request() got an unexpected keyword argument
 'follow_redirects'
This problem was introduced by the
change I90bc9d9fcd1058c3eca288f08dd134810f1b0000 to move
SessionClient from HTTPClient to adapter, due there is no
keyword argument 'follow_redirects' in keystoneclient
session.request() method.

Change-Id: I91f13da740bf1e66dffd68cdf666a24d68aa543d
Closes-Bug: #1471650

subject: ignore sample config file generated by tox -egenconfig
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 06:27:16.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': 'ignore sample config file generated by tox -egenconfig

After running tox -egenconfig, heat generates the sample configuration
file etc/heat/heat.conf.sample, however devs needs to delete it manually
to do futher work, otherwise it is always marked as untracked by git.

We should add it into .gitignore because it is an automatically generated

Change-Id: I7328dc385228dd620eca1d266dd411ea98e5d216
'}]
commit_message:
ignore sample config file generated by tox -egenconfig

After running tox -egenconfig, heat generates the sample configuration
file etc/heat/heat.conf.sample, however devs needs to delete it manually
to do futher work, otherwise it is always marked as untracked by git.

We should add it into .gitignore because it is an automatically generated
file by us

Modify the lib/tempest to not fail
 if no nova or glance available.

* This allows performance test of keystone and neutron with
  tempest (or tempest stress runner) without having system
  noise from another components.
* Depending on not required components for tempest is bad practice,
  tempest service decorators expected to allow tempest,
  to run in more minimal system out-of-the-box.

Change-Id: Ifc40b1eb5c4b79d96a5fae919b88afecca642ca0
(cherry picked from commit c411fcfc9224894db55d82b8ce4fa4a2b68de89d)

commit_message:
Allow installing tempest only with keystone

Modify the lib/tempest to not fail
 if no nova or glance available.

* This allows performance test of keystone and neutron with
  tempest (or tempest stress runner) without having system
  noise from another components.
* Depending on not required components for tempest is bad practice,
  tempest service decorators expected to allow tempest,
  to run in more minimal system out-of-the-box.

Change-Id: Ifc40b1eb5c4b79d96a5fae919b88afecca642ca0
(cherry picked from commit c411fcfc9224894db55d82b8ce4fa4a2b68de89d)

commit_message:
Fix manage_existing function in infortrend driver

For infortrend driver, it should update provider_location
information (partition id and system id).

Otherwise, the volume would miss the infortrend partition
after importing partition.

Change-Id: Icc34d2e6c27bca6580449aac5a54893b89dcd261

commit_message:
Split requirements

Splitting the requirements files into base, test, and optional
should make it easier for deployers to only install the parts they
care about.  In other words, someone running with qpid does not
need kombu installed, and someone running rabbit does not need qpid
installed.

Note that this depends on a change to pbr to handle nested
requirements so it won't work right now.  It's just a POC to
demonstrate how this might be done.

Author: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Co-Authored By: Denis Makogon <dmakogon@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9708322308655cbb4832fec1351ea1215e6e11ef
Depends-On: I893f9a1c259157bc6e6829fe34067ede365c15b7

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-02 16:14:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/hyper-v-vnuma-enable.rst'], 'message': 'Adds Hyper-V vNUMA enable spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-vnuma-enable

Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 introduces support for vNUMA topology into
Hyper-V virtual machines. This feature improves the performance for VMs
configured with large amounts of memory.

vNUMA can improve the performance of workloads running on virtual machines
that are configured with large amounts of memory. This feature is useful
for high-performance NUMA-aware applications, such as database or web
servers.

Change-Id: I0183b7074c0309961446a47809b36a07bae35770
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vnuma-enable
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V vNUMA enable spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-vnuma-enable

Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 introduces support for vNUMA topology into
Hyper-V virtual machines. This feature improves the performance for VMs
configured with large amounts of memory.

vNUMA can improve the performance of workloads running on virtual machines
that are configured with large amounts of memory. This feature is useful
for high-performance NUMA-aware applications, such as database or web
servers.

Change-Id: I0183b7074c0309961446a47809b36a07bae35770
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vnuma-enable

subject: Adds Hyper-V vTPM devices spec
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-26 12:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/hyper-v-vtpm-devices.rst'], 'message': "Adds Hyper-V vTPM devices spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-vtpm-devices

Windows / Hyper-V Server Technical Preview introduced the ability to
attach vTPM devices to the Hyper-V VMs, offering the users the
posibility to use it to enhance their security and system integrity.

Currently, there Hyper-V Driver doesn't support adding vTPM devices
to instances. This blueprint is addresing this issue.

Change-Id: I99650855e2290c2c2b77304f4891e11705195a1d
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vtpm-devices
"}]
commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V vTPM devices spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-vtpm-devices

Windows / Hyper-V Server Technical Preview introduced the ability to
attach vTPM devices to the Hyper-V VMs, offering the users the
posibility to use it to enhance their security and system integrity.

Currently, there Hyper-V Driver doesn't support adding vTPM devices
to instances. This blueprint is addresing this issue.

Change-Id: I99650855e2290c2c2b77304f4891e11705195a1d
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vtpm-devices

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 19:35:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Downgrade log level for gone port on status update

If a port is deleted immediately before a status update arrives
from the L2 agent, the port will be missing from the DB. The current
code was logging this at the warning level, but this occurs during
normal operations so it should only be a debug event.

Change-Id: I22af81e6807bfccb4c906ec0873fcbfca67b72df
'}]
commit_message:
Downgrade log level for gone port on status update

If a port is deleted immediately before a status update arrives
from the L2 agent, the port will be missing from the DB. The current
code was logging this at the warning level, but this occurs during
normal operations so it should only be a debug event.

Change-Id: I22af81e6807bfccb4c906ec0873fcbfca67b72df

sqlalchemy: fix lazy-loading of attributes

Use a string rather than a class attribute to be sure we correctly load
the resource attribute. Not sure it's a good fix but let's try!

by ID and by Name.

commit_message:
Add tests for python-cinderclient

Add tests for cinder volume creation and deletion
by ID and by Name.
Add test for cinder show volume output.
Add method to check general volume properties in CLI output.
Add method to get Volume ID from CLI output.
Add method to wait for given volume status.
Add method to check that volume deleted.
Add method to check that volume is not deleted (for negative cases).
Add method for volume deletion.

Change-Id: I06acb49f9e46a8911997b91e710b3cfb227a8f95
Implements: partial blueprint cinderclient-functional-tests

commit_message:
Allow to enable fencing, pass through fencing config

Add two new parameters: EnableFencing and FencingConfig.

FencingConfig is a json with an expected structure documented in the
templates. It gets passed further to puppet-tripleo, which configures
the fencing devices.

Fencing is configured and enabled in the last step after all pacemaker
resources and constraints have been created, which should be a more
stable approach than the other way round.

Change-Id: Ifd432bfd2443b6d13e7efa006d4120bb0eaa2554
Depends-On: I819fc8c126ec47cd207c59b3dcf92ff699649c5a
Depends-On: I8b7adff6f05f864115071c51810b41efad887584

commit_message:
Not compressing the mistral specific css

The style.scss in base.html seems to generate wrong
key in the offline manifest. since it's a small portion,
there is no performance issue in not compressing it, then
offline compression works again.

Change-Id: Ifeddd46ac25a7fc60f2bfd72c78dd2bc9cc04c0f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-06 08:13:12.000000000', 'files': ['mistraldashboard/api.py'], 'message': 'Reduce API client object in a request

Mistralclient is created every time methods in api.
It leads to regeneration of API HTTP connections.
This commit caches API client object for a WSGI request
to reduce the number of HTTP connection to backends.
As WSGI request object is recreated, a cached API client
object will live in a single request.

Change-Id: I46f101505801f8d650722c9c84397ab4d813e097
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce API client object in a request

Mistralclient is created every time methods in api.
It leads to regeneration of API HTTP connections.
This commit caches API client object for a WSGI request
to reduce the number of HTTP connection to backends.
As WSGI request object is recreated, a cached API client
object will live in a single request.

Change-Id: I46f101505801f8d650722c9c84397ab4d813e097

commit_message:
Add test 'check_ceph_cinder_cow' for ceph.

Cinder and Glance should use Ceph for this test.
Test creates RAW image and make a volume from it.
Volume should have a parent if copy-on-write used by Cinder.

- use OpenStackActions.create_image() instead of
      Common.image_import()

Change-Id: I136aa29abef492971c5be7ae732cd42f5c7f77bc
Closes-Bug:#1379543

all compute nodes) and the SWITCH API (local switch API).

subject: Upgrade code to be python 3 compatible
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-03 14:13:11.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/short_id.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/docker_conductor.py', 'magnum/common/utils.py', 'magnum/common/safe_utils.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'magnum/common/policy.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Upgrade code to be python 3 compatible

Various py2 to py3 fixes:
1. func.im_self to func.__self__
2. func.func_name to func.__name__
3. basestring to six.string_types
4. unicode to six.u
5. use bytes where appropriate instead of str
6. convert bytes to string for use with re
7. update usage of dict.keys()
8. update regex match for dealing with unicode characters, as '\w'
   matches unicode word characters in python 3 such as 的.

References:
[1] http://www.diveintopython3.net/porting-code-to-python-3-with-2to3.html#methodattrs
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.0.html#operators-and-special-methods
[3][4][5][6] https://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#text-vs-data-instead-of-unicode-vs-8-bit
[7] https://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#views-and-iterators-instead-of-lists
[8] https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#regular-expression-syntax

Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
Change-Id: I6a7e13feeecd66910f2046956b1edc4d871208f6
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade code to be python 3 compatible

Various py2 to py3 fixes:
1. func.im_self to func.__self__
2. func.func_name to func.__name__
3. basestring to six.string_types
4. unicode to six.u
5. use bytes where appropriate instead of str
6. convert bytes to string for use with re
7. update usage of dict.keys()
8. update regex match for dealing with unicode characters, as '\w'
   matches unicode word characters in python 3 such as 的.

References:
[1] http://www.diveintopython3.net/porting-code-to-python-3-with-2to3.html#methodattrs
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.0.html#operators-and-special-methods
[3][4][5][6] https://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#text-vs-data-instead-of-unicode-vs-8-bit
[7] https://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#views-and-iterators-instead-of-lists
[8] https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#regular-expression-syntax

Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
Change-Id: I6a7e13feeecd66910f2046956b1edc4d871208f6

commit_message:
Update heat policy.json

This patch sets stacks:global_index to role:admin in /etc/heat/policy.json,
so that an admin role can look for all stacks in heat, which a magnum periodic
task will be benefited from it.

Partial-Implements: blueprint add-periodic-task
Change-Id: I4669ef355d302607f42df182bba680dc548e9618

commit_message:
Make node index unique in a cluster

Currently when creating nodes in a specific cluster,
the indexs of node are configured to '-1' by default.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I12e11a44a7992a02701b4435f2b3bdaa0ac8475e
Closes-Bug: #1471668

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2015-07-02 09:03:46.000000000', 'files': ['etc/magnum/magnum.conf.sample', 'magnum/service/__init__.py', 'magnum/service/periodic.py', 'magnum/common/rpc_service.py', 'magnum/opts.py'], 'message': "Add periodic task framework

This patch adds periodic timer to conductor service.
Any new periodic tasks need to be added to magnum/service/periodic.py
We add 2 default configure options to support periodic task:
    'periodic_enable', default=True
    'periodic_interval_max', default=60
These 2 options are for rpc_service.
PS:
We don't need to supervisor timers because timer itself won't have any
exception, and it is not a thread, which means can not be killed.

Partial-Implements: blueprint add-periodic-task
Co-Authored-By: ShaoHe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Change-Id: I132d9cc89b26baf249b62b713ccd3776f0078d7d

commit_message:
Add periodic task framework

This patch adds periodic timer to conductor service.
Any new periodic tasks need to be added to magnum/service/periodic.py
We add 2 default configure options to support periodic task:
    'periodic_enable', default=True
    'periodic_interval_max', default=60
These 2 options are for rpc_service.
PS:
We don't need to supervisor timers because timer itself won't have any
exception, and it is not a thread, which means can not be killed.
