subject: Log deprecation message when catching deprecated exceptions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6601, 'name': 'James Carey', 'email': 'jecarey@yerac.com', 'username': 'jecarey'}, {'_account_id': 8648, 'name': 'Radomir Dopieralski', 'email': 'openstack@dopieralski.pl', 'username': 'thesheep'}, {'_account_id': 9397, 'name': 'Allison Randal', 'email': 'allison@lohutok.net', 'username': 'wendar'}, {'_account_id': 10795, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'tailor.rajesh88@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajeshtailor'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-09 10:12:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/versionutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_versionutils.py'], 'message': 'Log deprecation message when catching deprecated exceptions

When an exception is being deprecated from a library, it is usually
not called anywhere in the user code -- instead it is only caught, so
we never get a chance to see the deprecation message. This patch uses
the fact that an except statement has to do a subclass check on the
exceptions it is trying to catch, and puts the logging code in the
subclass check hook. Unfortunately, that hook has to be defined on the
metaclass, which makes the code a little hard to understand.

Change-Id: I30b4fe526e005f60e464bd8efe0cfbb68f47512e
'}]
commit_message:
Log deprecation message when catching deprecated exceptions

When an exception is being deprecated from a library, it is usually
not called anywhere in the user code -- instead it is only caught, so
we never get a chance to see the deprecation message. This patch uses
the fact that an except statement has to do a subclass check on the
exceptions it is trying to catch, and puts the logging code in the
subclass check hook. Unfortunately, that hook has to be defined on the
metaclass, which makes the code a little hard to understand.

Change-Id: I30b4fe526e005f60e464bd8efe0cfbb68f47512e

commit_message:
zmq: support Cinder multi-backend server targets

Cinder provides the server part of a target for a multi-backend in the
format <server>@<backend>; if this is presented, pick the <server> part
for the outgoing messaging target.

Change-Id: I175a0c013d422344c723aca4c696eaac481b9142
Closes-Bug: #1381972

subject: Remove argument examining and exception raising in action init
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-06 07:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/actions/base.py'], 'message': "Remove argument examining and exception raising in action init

For built-in actions, the correctness of init arguments should be
ensured during code development progress. For customized actions
that will be supported in future, arguments validation should be
done in earlier stage, e.g. API or engine service layer. Therefore,
those exception raising in action init actually doesn't make sense.
So this patch removed them.

Change-Id: I724cc305a0bd2cbb158d03bcf4065a395824b938
"}]
commit_message:
Remove argument examining and exception raising in action init

For built-in actions, the correctness of init arguments should be
ensured during code development progress. For customized actions
that will be supported in future, arguments validation should be
done in earlier stage, e.g. API or engine service layer. Therefore,
those exception raising in action init actually doesn't make sense.
So this patch removed them.

Change-Id: I724cc305a0bd2cbb158d03bcf4065a395824b938

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to show_server method

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to show_server method of compute clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I92addd2ad6502fe00395e2b9455de25c2f53d115

commit_message:
Add file/dir check upon backup using tar

When a tar backup is made the freezer client checks whether
the parameter to --path-to-backup is a file or a directory
and creates the correct tar command

ready.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-26 08:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py'], 'message': "Re-factor neutron client for 'delete' methods

Currently neutron client is written to auto generate
methods on fly. This is very difficult to debug and
make code very difficult to read.

As neutron client will be moved to lib, it will be better to
have its interfaces more readable and consistent with other
service clients.

This commit re-factor it for 'delete_*' methods.

commit_message:
Re-factor neutron client for 'delete' methods

Currently neutron client is written to auto generate
methods on fly. This is very difficult to debug and
make code very difficult to read.

As neutron client will be moved to lib, it will be better to
have its interfaces more readable and consistent with other
service clients.

This commit re-factor it for 'delete_*' methods.

Change-Id: I8b37555a250e5988553c3cdcfc4851487f27ea38

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-06 02:39:30.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/common/test_exception.py', 'magnum/common/exception.py'], 'message': 'Fix the function "wrap_exception"

commit_message:
Fix the function "wrap_exception"

* The call notifier.notify(...) is invalid since the method doesn't
  exist. Replace it with notifier.error(...).
* The call getcallargs(...) misses the 'context' argument.
* Added unit test cases for this function.

Change-Id: Icc21e17b9eac77e6c1ac8eda483b4afd7bcc8243
Closes-Bug: 1471629

commit_message:
Re-factor neutron client for 'show' methods

Currently neutron client is written to auto generate
methods on fly. This is very difficult to debug and
make code very difficult to read.

As neutron client will be moved to lib, it will be better to
have its interfaces more readable and consistent with other
service clients.

This commit re-factor it for 'show_*' methods.

Change-Id: I953ef3fdbae7b9d630b1de2a324142ad00d29b57

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-03 21:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/cmds/edit_constraint.py', 'openstack_requirements/tests/test_edit_constraint.py', 'openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py', 'openstack_requirements/requirement.py'], 'message': 'Fix editing constraints files with urls in them.

constraints files, unlike global_requirements, need to be able to
contain urls (specifically file:/// paths) so that we can constrain
libraries to be run from their git trees, rather than having them flap
all over the place as different servers specify different bounds. The
first edit-constraints implementation failed to parse such lines,
throwing errors instead.

This patch makes the support for urls optional, preventing changing
the semantics of requirements update.py logic.

Change-Id: I33bd2d9dff9cb7dc1a50177db7286b7317966784
Depends-On: I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix editing constraints files with urls in them.

constraints files, unlike global_requirements, need to be able to
contain urls (specifically file:/// paths) so that we can constrain
libraries to be run from their git trees, rather than having them flap
all over the place as different servers specify different bounds. The
first edit-constraints implementation failed to parse such lines,
throwing errors instead.

This patch makes the support for urls optional, preventing changing
the semantics of requirements update.py logic.

Change-Id: I33bd2d9dff9cb7dc1a50177db7286b7317966784
Depends-On: I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2

commit_message:
Better Scenario test case fixtures

This adds five persistent fixtures for Scenario test cases; previously
they had been variously mocked, patched, etc., in different ways
individually in many test cases. It improves the way those fixtures
are used, mostly by using the .return_value attribute of Mock objects
instead of calling the Mock objects in the test cases and dealing with
strange side effects of that. It also adds assertions for
get_from_manager() calls.

Change-Id: I81a69683ef8ca0fc00bb408c951ec2f9a98e7ba0

commit_message:
Display default values of scenario paramters

Currently, rally info command doesn't display default values of scenario
parameters. Such extension can be very useful for those folks who do not 
want look at code before writing configuration of task.

Change-Id: I69da8912a3b01b6368c034b89f781222acb7c6fc

subject: Nova's flavor migration should be run within-kilo not from-kilo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 19:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['projects/60_nova/within-kilo/upgrade-nova', 'projects/60_nova/upgrade.sh'], 'message': "Nova's flavor migration should be run within-kilo not from-kilo

We actually need to run migrate_flavor_data on kilo code, before we upgrade to
the new code. We want to remove that compatibility code, and this started to
fail when we tried. So, this patch makes sure that we run the within-kilo step
(as provided for in the plugin docs) and do the migrate_flavor_data there.

Change-Id: I9daa648f803218bf1d8b7b7686ab73e146eeb04b
"}]
commit_message:
Nova's flavor migration should be run within-kilo not from-kilo

We actually need to run migrate_flavor_data on kilo code, before we upgrade to
the new code. We want to remove that compatibility code, and this started to
fail when we tried. So, this patch makes sure that we run the within-kilo step
(as provided for in the plugin docs) and do the migrate_flavor_data there.

Change-Id: I9daa648f803218bf1d8b7b7686ab73e146eeb04b

subject: resource-list --nested-depth stack_name column
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-26 02:12:23.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/v1/resources.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/test_resources.py'], 'message': 'resource-list --nested-depth stack_name column

For resource-list --nested-depth an extra column parent_resource
is added to the result. This has the following issues:
- parent_resource values cannot be used as the stack argument to
  resource-show
- templates with more than one ResourceGroup will have more than one
  parent_resource called "0", so there is no way of inferring the actual
  parent, and it is not possible to guess the correct parent resource
- parent_resource is inconsistent with event-list --nested-depth, which
  adds a stack_name column that doesn't have the above disadvantages.

This change replaces the parent_resource column with a stack_name
column for resource-list --nested-depth.

Change-Id: I6b4bc306db48e08931ff294bcbefeb6bbb195663
Closes-bug: #1467332
'}]
commit_message:
resource-list --nested-depth stack_name column

For resource-list --nested-depth an extra column parent_resource
is added to the result. This has the following issues:
- parent_resource values cannot be used as the stack argument to
  resource-show
- templates with more than one ResourceGroup will have more than one
  parent_resource called "0", so there is no way of inferring the actual
  parent, and it is not possible to guess the correct parent resource
- parent_resource is inconsistent with event-list --nested-depth, which
  adds a stack_name column that doesn't have the above disadvantages.

This change replaces the parent_resource column with a stack_name
column for resource-list --nested-depth.

Change-Id: I6b4bc306db48e08931ff294bcbefeb6bbb195663
Closes-bug: #1467332

or detach interface to a instance. So add some exception handle

commit_message:
Implement the update_migrated_volume for the drivers

This patch implements update_migrated_volume for LVM and Storwize
driver. It makes sure that after a successful volume migration,
the cinder volume name(id) is the same as the backend volume name(id).
Other back-end drivers can take this patch as a reference
to implement update_migrated_volume.

PS: Not applicable to attached or multi-attached volumes, since we need
to wait until the multi-attach lands in Nova.

Change-Id: I60797340ddf2b55286ff0d84319529b2f502cefa
Partially-closes-bug: #1450649

commit_message:
devref: document API status for neutron.openstack.common.*

Make sure we document the fact that neutron.openstack.common.* contents
are not meant to be used by external repositories (except, temporarily,
*aas repos).

If I could bootstrap the oslo-incubator subtree from scratch, I would
put it under neutron._openstack, to indicate that it's for internal
usage only. But we can't do it now, so instead I update devref.

Change-Id: I42252a7b0a07759c57995b2fc1f8d20ecba7d33b

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-03 21:56:17.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python'], 'message': "Fix library runs.

Libraries were resulting in two edit-constraints runs:
 - one for the library, which adds a non-editable file path
 - then one for the editable servers, but that fails becuse
   pkg-resources couldn't parse the prior entry.

This is fixed in two parts: the dependent patch which supports parsing
file urls that have egg names, and this patch which changes from a
file path to a file url with an egg name.

Change-Id: I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix library runs.

Libraries were resulting in two edit-constraints runs:
 - one for the library, which adds a non-editable file path
 - then one for the editable servers, but that fails becuse
   pkg-resources couldn't parse the prior entry.

This is fixed in two parts: the dependent patch which supports parsing
file urls that have egg names, and this patch which changes from a
file path to a file url with an egg name.

Change-Id: I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2

subject: Replace extract-docs.awk with extract-docs.py
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-05 05:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/extract-docs.awk', 'scripts/extract-docs.py', 'scripts/extract-docs'], 'message': "Replace extract-docs.awk with extract-docs.py

extract-docs.py has several nice features over extract-docs.awk. The
obvious advantage is that it's easier for python developers to read than
the awk script (not that the awk script was particularly hard)

More importantly, this script has the property that it preserves line
numbers - so when you get a failure on line 206 of devtest.rst, that
means the error is on line 206 of devtest.sh, rather than being on some
random other line number.

I'd like to see this script integrated into Sphinx as a dedicated
pre-processor, but in the meantime this should help us make errors
building docs easier to read.

Change-Id: Ibb6f943e3f6b30f1bdbc0b8d7b73f7b32f75fc6a
"}]
commit_message:
Replace extract-docs.awk with extract-docs.py

extract-docs.py has several nice features over extract-docs.awk. The
obvious advantage is that it's easier for python developers to read than
the awk script (not that the awk script was particularly hard)

More importantly, this script has the property that it preserves line
numbers - so when you get a failure on line 206 of devtest.rst, that
means the error is on line 206 of devtest.sh, rather than being on some
random other line number.

I'd like to see this script integrated into Sphinx as a dedicated
pre-processor, but in the meantime this should help us make errors
building docs easier to read.

Change-Id: Ibb6f943e3f6b30f1bdbc0b8d7b73f7b32f75fc6a

subject: CI - Depends-On support - Repo
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-29 17:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['bootstrap.sh'], 'message': 'CI - Depends-On support - Repo

This patch will use the Depends-On support enabled in the Common
bootstrap. The repo Berksfile already has support for REPO_DEV to
find cookbooks in a local path.  This change will enable the
repo to also be able to use the Depends-On commit message flag to
pull in dependent cookbooks.

To use Depends-On, add the following to your commit message AFTER
the description and BEFORE the change id and bug or blue print ref.
"Depends-On: <id>"
The id is the change id of the gerrit patch this patch depends on.

Change-Id: I7f9bc45995073ae210656835108b4e6a5257b082
'}]
commit_message:
CI - Depends-On support - Repo

This patch will use the Depends-On support enabled in the Common
bootstrap. The repo Berksfile already has support for REPO_DEV to
find cookbooks in a local path.  This change will enable the
repo to also be able to use the Depends-On commit message flag to
pull in dependent cookbooks.

To use Depends-On, add the following to your commit message AFTER
the description and BEFORE the change id and bug or blue print ref.
"Depends-On: <id>"
The id is the change id of the gerrit patch this patch depends on.

Change-Id: I7f9bc45995073ae210656835108b4e6a5257b082

commit_message:
Move conductor common implementations into module

This allows common implementations to be reused later. Below is
the list of methods that were moved and renamed:
* handlers.k8s_conductor._retrieve_bay -> utils.retrieve_bay
* handlers.bay_conductor._get_baymodel -> utils.retrieve_bay
* handlers.k8s_conductor._retrieve_baymodel -> utils.retrieve_baymodel
* handlers.k8s_conductor._object_has_stack -> utils.object_has_stack
* handlers.k8s_conductor._retrieve_k8s_master_url ->
                                      k8s_api._retrieve_k8s_master_url
* handlers.k8s_conductor.Handler.k8s_api -> k8s_api.create_k8s_api

Change-Id: Ia10625f35667fd9309dc3627e2f2d31455dd19be

commit_message:
changing email from user list deletes user passwd

Fix bug for changing user's email from user list deletes user password.
Don't set password to None in update_cell function in user tables.

Change-Id: I9d96ca2aa806a0398de85c4866900b445eefee05
Closes-Bug: #1468300
(cherry picked from commit 0eb16dfa7ef4ec30c6b266c6006f4c4574199702)

commit_message:
Python3: do not use urllib.urlencode

It has been moved in Python3. Use six.moves to have code that works with both
Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I5f286b1f784b3b7bb37852b00169a6c1227eb74b
Blueprint: neutron-python3

subject: Remove unneeded OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 23:06:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove unneeded OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION

The desired OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION string is now reflected
in the oslo.db 1.12.0 release's default behavior, and so does not
need to be set any longer to achieve the same opportunistic backend
discovery for tests.

Change-Id: Ib6b0d476ae1d75ca25ac3737cd83bdd0aa3d94eb
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION

The desired OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION string is now reflected
in the oslo.db 1.12.0 release's default behavior, and so does not
need to be set any longer to achieve the same opportunistic backend
discovery for tests.

Change-Id: Ib6b0d476ae1d75ca25ac3737cd83bdd0aa3d94eb

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-01 02:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_disassociate

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_disassociate.

network_disassociate is called by:
  1. network.manager.disassociate_network, no one call this function.
  2. network.api.associate, this is fixed by
     I5c19109b29a1463304b51d7fe05f01456a9ccfb0

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_disassociate

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_disassociate.

network_disassociate is called by:
  1. network.manager.disassociate_network, no one call this function.
  2. network.api.associate, this is fixed by
     I5c19109b29a1463304b51d7fe05f01456a9ccfb0

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: I46aa09b9fd71759d96a641455f0a98ba47d19c2a

commit_message:
Remove useless policy rule from fake_policy.py

This patch remove some policy rules from fake_policy.py which never used
in nova code. Also remove some 'discovery' entries which used by v2.1 extensions,
as v2.1 extensions will be removed later.

Change-Id: Ia15733208b058194200d01447a69f54f58643260

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_set_host

This patches removes the DB layer hard-coded permission checks for
network_set_host.

network_set_host is called by:
  1. network.manager._setup_network_on_host, it is call by
     network.manager.allocate_for_instance and
     nova.network.manager.add_fixed_ip_to_instance
     There is still another policy check on the method, but they are
     fixed by Ia33080c1681b139dbca72bfd5c9810e8fbea6719
  2. network_api.associate.
     There is another policy check on the method and it is merged. is
     fixed by I5c19109b29a1463304b51d7fe05f01456a9ccfb0

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: Ie23db8b58a2b134092ba4cc5532ff0158cb8d68e

Cinder volume logs sometimes show this error

      NetApp API failed. Reason - 13114:
      No actual-pathname for 10.1.0.9:/vol/whatever

with Kilo code and 7-mode DOT system.

The issue is due to our Cinder driver passing the
entire share to the relevant API instead of just
the export path portion of the share.  This only
happens when the NFS image cache is full, and cached
files need to be removed.

Change-Id: I0c40840dac975dd7fd2c62f1f9c0cd3f8c5c1252
Closes-Bug: #1468884
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'no actual-pathname' NetApp API error

Cinder volume logs sometimes show this error

      NetApp API failed. Reason - 13114:
      No actual-pathname for 10.1.0.9:/vol/whatever

with Kilo code and 7-mode DOT system.

The issue is due to our Cinder driver passing the
entire share to the relevant API instead of just
the export path portion of the share.  This only
happens when the NFS image cache is full, and cached
files need to be removed.

Change-Id: I0c40840dac975dd7fd2c62f1f9c0cd3f8c5c1252
Closes-Bug: #1468884

commit_message:
VMware: vmware_ostype should be enum

The vmware_ostype property is a string property defining the
available operating system types that can be associated with a
VM.  The os types should be a enumeration rather than just a
free form string.

Change-Id: Ifa5d71299c34b4613adf0107eb3fadf25ec3e906

subject: Add Puppetfile and install script
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-02 19:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['Puppetfile', 'install_modules.sh'], 'message': 'Add Puppetfile and install script

This repo will be cloned by the puppet modules and used to install
modules in functional tests. The script uses r10k to deploy modules
from the Puppetfile because this is the Puppet Labs recommended way to
manage puppet environments, and it is a popular method among our users.
We install all modules from git, not the forge, because r10k does not
give us dependency resolution so installing from the forge does not buy
us anything. If the modules have stable branches in git, r10k uses the
stable branch as a ref, otherwise it uses a tag (pinning to a specific
release).

If zuul-cloner is available, the script first installs the external
modules with r10k, then extracts the OpenStack modules from the
Puppetfile to install with zuul-cloner. In the future, this part may be
split out into a JJB job.

Note: because r10k purges the modules directory before installing
modules, and this feature cannot be turned off[1], we must run r10k to
install the external modules before running zuul-cloner to install the
OpenStack modules.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/r10k/issues/172

Change-Id: Ide59ef4bdf53a04957e3593815b7514a0e744e0e
'}]
commit_message:
Add Puppetfile and install script

This repo will be cloned by the puppet modules and used to install
modules in functional tests. The script uses r10k to deploy modules
from the Puppetfile because this is the Puppet Labs recommended way to
manage puppet environments, and it is a popular method among our users.
We install all modules from git, not the forge, because r10k does not
give us dependency resolution so installing from the forge does not buy
us anything. If the modules have stable branches in git, r10k uses the
stable branch as a ref, otherwise it uses a tag (pinning to a specific
release).

If zuul-cloner is available, the script first installs the external
modules with r10k, then extracts the OpenStack modules from the
Puppetfile to install with zuul-cloner. In the future, this part may be
split out into a JJB job.

Note: because r10k purges the modules directory before installing
modules, and this feature cannot be turned off[1], we must run r10k to
install the external modules before running zuul-cloner to install the
OpenStack modules.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/r10k/issues/172

Change-Id: Ide59ef4bdf53a04957e3593815b7514a0e744e0e

commit_message:
Add notifications about snapshot.update.*

Now we have notifications about volume.update.*, but don't have
notifications about snapshot.update.*
In this patchset added this notifications.

Change-Id: Idc17516436b06871421c17cde0e2128f81613716

subject: Implement saving certificate in memory
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-02 08:17:01.000000000', 'files': ['anchor/X509/certificate.py', 'anchor/certificate_ops.py'], 'message': 'Implement saving certificate in memory

Remove a todo item/comment. Instead of operating on files in the X509
code, only serialise the certificate as PEM and return it. Other code
should deal with disk operations.

Change-Id: I4dff4591f242a1c8ea233f972e66b38c36bd9640
'}]
commit_message:
Implement saving certificate in memory

Remove a todo item/comment. Instead of operating on files in the X509
code, only serialise the certificate as PEM and return it. Other code
should deal with disk operations.

Change-Id: I4dff4591f242a1c8ea233f972e66b38c36bd9640

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-24 15:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_backup_driver_base.py', 'cinder/backup/driver.py', 'cinder/quota.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix Python 3 issues in backup

* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types: the "long" type has been
  removed in Python 3
* Replace str.encode("bas64") with base64.encodestring(str), base64
  text codec has been removed in Python 3. Same change for decode
  (base64.decodestring)
* On Python 3, encode JSON to UTF-8
* tox.ini: add the following tests to Python 3

  - cinder.tests.unit.test_backup
  - cinder.tests.unit.test_backup_driver_base

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I86e04f8fbe9a3ce8849fd141dc3ee914e73c8796
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in backup

* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types: the "long" type has been
  removed in Python 3
* Replace str.encode("bas64") with base64.encodestring(str), base64
  text codec has been removed in Python 3. Same change for decode
  (base64.decodestring)
* On Python 3, encode JSON to UTF-8
* tox.ini: add the following tests to Python 3

  - cinder.tests.unit.test_backup
  - cinder.tests.unit.test_backup_driver_base

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I86e04f8fbe9a3ce8849fd141dc3ee914e73c8796

This patch simply adds a 'policy' directory with a few json

commit_message:
Add policy files specific to NSX plugins

This patch simply adds a 'policy' directory with a few json
files into ./etc/neutron/plugins/vmware to provide default
policies specific to the VMware NSX plugin family.

These policy files can be loaded leveraging the policy_dirs
configuration option.

Change-Id: Icce41a6ee63715bc145694f27a2166a7fa884dba

revisions:

lead to long test timeouts.

Change-Id: Iff89e9cdd33dcafc6fd6743ddea810cf3c949e90
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent DNS lookups in tests

Don't try to do actual DNS lookups, even on bad domains. This can
lead to long test timeouts.

Change-Id: Iff89e9cdd33dcafc6fd6743ddea810cf3c949e90

commit_message:
Collapse create_subnet into single method

Previously create_subnet called different methods for subnet allocation
with subnetpool and without it.

_create_subnet_from_implicit_pool and _create_subnet_from_pool
were collapsed into single method _create_subnet.
This is intermediate step for supporting pluggable ipam.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: Ia6cfc2c15e29f983a623772f5473166c075a20e4

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-02 09:01:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/callbacks/resources.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Add extension callbacks support for networks

Add callbacks for extention to the network resource so that interested
extensions can do custom logic when a network is created or updated.

Currently it will be done the same way port notifications are done -
i.e. only in ML2 plugin. We can revisit this in a floow up patch if the
whole notification logic should be moved somewhere else as this merits
further discussion which is out of scope for a mere patch.

Change-Id: I38528863e1145caf05fe3b2425511d1c5b5c0f93
'}]
commit_message:
Add extension callbacks support for networks

Add callbacks for extention to the network resource so that interested
extensions can do custom logic when a network is created or updated.

Currently it will be done the same way port notifications are done -
i.e. only in ML2 plugin. We can revisit this in a floow up patch if the
whole notification logic should be moved somewhere else as this merits
further discussion which is out of scope for a mere patch.

This will be utilized in a follow up commit.

Partially-implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Change-Id: I38528863e1145caf05fe3b2425511d1c5b5c0f93

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 07:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_configuration.py'], 'message': 'Fixes the tests in test_configuration.py

operating_system.chmod needs to be mocked,
without which when these tests are run starts
calling the actual chmod which then fails.

Added the mock for operating_system.chmod to help tests work.

Change-Id: I8435735442e8eafef39e2d8c2ed674be89f96245
Closes-Bug: #1470362
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes the tests in test_configuration.py

operating_system.chmod needs to be mocked,
without which when these tests are run starts
calling the actual chmod which then fails.

Added the mock for operating_system.chmod to help tests work.

Change-Id: I8435735442e8eafef39e2d8c2ed674be89f96245
Closes-Bug: #1470362

commit_message:
Support Basic Address Scope CRUD as extensions

This patch adds the support for basic address scope CRUD.
Subsequent patches will be added to use this address scope
on subnet pools.

DocImpact
APIImpact

commit_message:
Global Cinder setting not seen by group conf

This patch documents how to configure Fiber Channel configuration
groups with copy image to volume multipathing option. Since
LVM doesn't support multipath I've used HP 3PAR and EMC as examples.

Change-Id: I3491046d0bd79a27df7c67472048fefa5d9a3f8e
Closes-Bug: #1326571

commit_message:
Modifies _boot_server() to handle instances with multiple networks

This enables the option to an instance with more than one network attached.
Existing behavior remains untouched.

Change-Id: Ic0705f794e34b8aca54f59e7bfbb188bae94c45b
Closes-Bug: #1420755

subject: Adds dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) support for scenarios
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 8576, 'name': 'Yair Fried', 'email': 'yfried@redhat.com', 'username': 'yfried'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-03-30 12:35:21.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/context/network.py', 'rally/benchmark/wrappers/network.py', 'tests/unit/benchmark/wrappers/test_network.py'], 'message': 'Adds dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) support for scenarios

Modifies NeutronWrapper class and Network context with multiple nets and IPv6
NetworkWrapper:
adds default IPv6 start CIDR.

NeutronWrapper:
Modifies create_network with the option to connect it to an existing router.
Adds delete_router for routers not created via create_network.
Adds list ports, list routers, list router ports

Network context:
setup: option of additional IPv6 network.
To support IPv6 tests over IPv4 infrastucture (as currently exists
in openstack gates), each instnace will have IPv4 with floating-ip as in
legacy mode. By doing that, we can test IPv6 networks by first connecting
to an IPv4 floating-ip.
dual-stack networks will be named with identical prefix to indicate they
belong to the same stack and connected to the same neutron router.
cleanup: standalone routers cleanup.

Change-Id: I2d8ec9a547bdedba419be6ad16bed41364fa5e4e
Closes-Bug: #1420823
'}]
commit_message:
Adds dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) support for scenarios

Modifies NeutronWrapper class and Network context with multiple nets and IPv6
NetworkWrapper:
adds default IPv6 start CIDR.

NeutronWrapper:
Modifies create_network with the option to connect it to an existing router.
Adds delete_router for routers not created via create_network.
Adds list ports, list routers, list router ports

Network context:
setup: option of additional IPv6 network.
To support IPv6 tests over IPv4 infrastucture (as currently exists
in openstack gates), each instnace will have IPv4 with floating-ip as in
legacy mode. By doing that, we can test IPv6 networks by first connecting
to an IPv4 floating-ip.
dual-stack networks will be named with identical prefix to indicate they
belong to the same stack and connected to the same neutron router.
cleanup: standalone routers cleanup.

Change-Id: I2d8ec9a547bdedba419be6ad16bed41364fa5e4e
Closes-Bug: #1420823

commit_message:
(WIP) Adds IPv6 Scenario to vmtasks

Boot an instance with both IPv4 and IPv6 interfaces.
From within an instance, ping6 the the IPv6 default gateway.

This scenario relays on other patches
that are part of "IPv6 Tests" gerrit topic.
Therefore, It will counts as work in progress for the time being.

Change-Id: I65cb4af6c4a153eb5daa28f435c554bde9da8e1d

Updated statement on heat command-line client interactions

The heat command-line client communicates with the heat-api to
run OpenStack-native REST APIs, not AWS CloudFormation APIs.

commit_message:
Add --os-endpoint-type cli optional argument

User should be able to specify the endpoint type through
a CLI optional argument/ENV variable setting. We will name this new
optional argument: --os-endpoint-type (Env: OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE) and
based on the value given, the service API will use that specific
endpoint type. Possible values: public, admin, internal.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1454392
Change-Id: Ife3d4e46b44c0ddcd712b1130e27e362545a9a29

subject: Don't put subnet pools in a scope by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 22:15:07.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/address-scopes.rst'], 'message': "Don't put subnet pools in a scope by default

The problem is that subnet pools are already out there and people are
likely to use them before address scopes are available.  To introduce
address scopes and immediately apply the routing restrictions to
existing subnet pools in Liberty could come as quite a shock to
existing users.

I'm putting this up as a change to the BP to get opinions and see if
they align.

Change-Id: I2fbdf31a818c8d96af78a47778aea4a24c24cbf3
"}]
commit_message:
Don't put subnet pools in a scope by default

The problem is that subnet pools are already out there and people are
likely to use them before address scopes are available.  To introduce
address scopes and immediately apply the routing restrictions to
existing subnet pools in Liberty could come as quite a shock to
existing users.

I'm putting this up as a change to the BP to get opinions and see if
they align.

Change-Id: I2fbdf31a818c8d96af78a47778aea4a24c24cbf3

commit_message:
Use EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING instead of ALLOWED_SERVICES

We can derive the services from EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING, therefore
there is no need for duplicating the service labels into ALLOWED_SERVICES.

Change-Id: If92e0ea3dea4480588141a2819ea4036c527c9bc

Add new script to fetch tarballs for source installation

This script will be sourced from the build scripts to provide alternate

provided to a Dockerfile for source installation.

subject: Fix Python 3 issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 18:44:59.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/splice.py'], 'message': "Fix Python 3 issues

* Replace long with six.integer_type

six.integer_type :In Python 2, this is long and int, and in Python 3,
just int.

'long' is an undefined variable in py3.

Change-Id: Ibe4c5d0d81fe883f4fe33be93a68d814a228ad28
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues

* Replace long with six.integer_type

six.integer_type :In Python 2, this is long and int, and in Python 3,
just int.

'long' is an undefined variable in py3.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-02 12:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "API: make sure a blank volume with no size is rejected

Currently - we would happily accept the request, but fail to create the
block device mapping record for such a volume. The result was that the
boot request for such an instance would be accepted, but would not
create a volume.

Also fix the _volume_size API method that was 0ing out blank volume's
size by mistake.

Change-Id: I1d243aed78da7c026e55ea145397b070d619a567
Closes-bug: #1461638
"}]
commit_message:
API: make sure a blank volume with no size is rejected

Currently - we would happily accept the request, but fail to create the
block device mapping record for such a volume. The result was that the
boot request for such an instance would be accepted, but would not
create a volume.

Also fix the _volume_size API method that was 0ing out blank volume's
size by mistake.

Change-Id: I1d243aed78da7c026e55ea145397b070d619a567
Closes-bug: #1461638

subject: Fix metadata syntax error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 01:14:40.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json'], 'message': "Fix metadata syntax error

Module dependencies with upper and lower bounds on semantic versions
must not have their bounds separated by a comma. If they do, `puppet
module list` warns that this is invalid:

 Warning: Non semantic version dependency 'stackforge-keystone' (v5.1.0):
   'stackforge-designate' (v5.0.0) requires 'stackforge-keystone' (>=5.0.0, <6.0.0)

This patch corrects the error.

Change-Id: I368181bb961b2d9aaafaf6bd19a8f019adfafb76
"}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata syntax error

Module dependencies with upper and lower bounds on semantic versions
must not have their bounds separated by a comma. If they do, `puppet
module list` warns that this is invalid:

 Warning: Non semantic version dependency 'stackforge-keystone' (v5.1.0):
   'stackforge-designate' (v5.0.0) requires 'stackforge-keystone' (>=5.0.0, <6.0.0)

This patch corrects the error.

Change-Id: I368181bb961b2d9aaafaf6bd19a8f019adfafb76

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-01 21:22:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l2_ovs_agent.py'], 'message': 'Change the half of the bridge name used for ports

The code to generate the names of the patch ports
was based on a chunk of the bridge name starting from
the beginning. With the long suffix, this ended up
excluding all of the random characters in the name.
(e.g. br-int374623235 would create an interface br-in-patch-tun).

This meant that if two tests using patch interfaces ran together,
they would have a name collision and one would fail.

This patch updates the patch port name generation to use the
randomized back portion of the name.

Change-Id: I172e0b2c0b53e8c7151bd92f0915773ea62c0c6a
Closes-Bug: #1470637
'}]
commit_message:
Change the half of the bridge name used for ports

The code to generate the names of the patch ports
was based on a chunk of the bridge name starting from
the beginning. With the long suffix, this ended up
excluding all of the random characters in the name.
(e.g. br-int374623235 would create an interface br-in-patch-tun).

This meant that if two tests using patch interfaces ran together,
they would have a name collision and one would fail.

This patch updates the patch port name generation to use the
randomized back portion of the name.

Change-Id: I172e0b2c0b53e8c7151bd92f0915773ea62c0c6a
Closes-Bug: #1470637

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-01 20:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py'], 'message': "Fix log traces induced by retry decorator

Patch 4e77442d5 added a retry decorator to the API layer
to catch DB deadlock errors. However, when they occur, the
retried operation ends up being ineffective because the original
body has been altered, which leads the notification and validation
layers to barf exceptions due to unrecognized/unserializable elements.

This ultimately results to an error reported to the user.

To address this, let's make a deep copy of the request body, before
we pass it down to the lower layers. This allows the decorator to
work on a pristine copy of the body on every attempt. The performance
impact for this should be negligible.

Closes-bug: #1470615

Change-Id: I82a2a002612d28fa8f97b0afbd4f7ba1e8830377
"}]
commit_message:
Fix log traces induced by retry decorator

Patch 4e77442d5 added a retry decorator to the API layer
to catch DB deadlock errors. However, when they occur, the
retried operation ends up being ineffective because the original
body has been altered, which leads the notification and validation
layers to barf exceptions due to unrecognized/unserializable elements.

This ultimately results to an error reported to the user.

To address this, let's make a deep copy of the request body, before
we pass it down to the lower layers. This allows the decorator to
work on a pristine copy of the body on every attempt. The performance
impact for this should be negligible.

Closes-bug: #1470615

Change-Id: I82a2a002612d28fa8f97b0afbd4f7ba1e8830377

commit_message:
Escape initial values, that come from muranopl

Currently help_text is rendered directly from muranopl code.
This commit escapes help_text, an other parameters, that are passed
directly to django forms from muranopl class definitions.

Also escapes initial values for object fields, that contain application
names, which come directly from users.

Change-Id: Iadd092669a13e99b0e9f0d062a1d1d9a630b00a1
Closes-Bug: #1453138

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-12 20:34:51.000000000', 'files': ['tools/neutron.bash_completion'], 'message': "Allow bash completion script to work with BSD sed

Shorthand \s isn't POSIX compliant; it works with GNU sed, but not BSD sed.
Changed \s to the literal whitespace character to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I936b372e4022a4717a64cea9a8928b6dc00c6711
Closes-Bug: #1459470
Closes-Bug: #1277492
"}]
commit_message:
Allow bash completion script to work with BSD sed

Shorthand \s isn't POSIX compliant; it works with GNU sed, but not BSD sed.
Changed \s to the literal whitespace character to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I936b372e4022a4717a64cea9a8928b6dc00c6711
Closes-Bug: #1459470
Closes-Bug: #1277492

commit_message:
Ansible Rabbitmq support

Adds initial support for Rabbitmq in Ansible using the CONFIG_EXTERNAL methods.

Additionally, this refactors some of the Rabbitmq config script to allow for
reuse by CONFIG_EXTERNAL.

Partially Implements: blueprint ansible-service

Change-Id: I1765548f7e4f1258eb8a49e2a23242955f52655d

commit_message:
Ansible Mariadb w/ Galera support

Adds initial support for Mariadb with Galera replication in Ansible
using the CONFIG_EXTERNAL methods.

Additionally, this refactors some of the Galera config script to allow
for reuse by CONFIG_EXTERNAL.

Partially Implements: blueprint ansible-service

Change-Id: I566fea0376ecca39fc8a5167f9ff9ff434ea7b7e

commit_message:
Remove unneeded OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION

The desired OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION string is now reflected
in the oslo.db 1.12.0 release's default behavior, and so does not
need to be set any longer to achieve the same opportunistic backend
discovery for tests.

Change-Id: I9e7239c71371bc872f5ae41e4f0f3c8942f3d9b3

commit_message:
Solidfire drive page warning needs to be reworded.

The Solidfire driver no longer creates accounts with the hostname prepended.
The warning message is now changed to indicate that the old behavior can be
retained with a hostname in the config file.

Change-Id: Ia7b172f8400403b7dae63307749a58ce9ea33a8f
Closes-Bug: 1470162

commit_message:
Support floating IP and configurable auth methods

Updates compute tests to support connecting to servers using their
floating IP address.  Authenticating either keypair, password or the
servers admin password.

Partially implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy

Change-Id: I6ebf36a3d80c7721d8775a676d86927bf4da737d

So this patch fixes it in quickstart document.

Use a env var instead of manually editing repo files to use
centos.   This also makes it easy for new tools like, test-patch
to switch between the platforms.

Next step will be to allow REPO_DEVICE=  to easily

I think env vars are a simple way to handle this, but we could also

commit_message:
Allow env var REPO_OS to easily switch between platforms

Use a env var instead of manually editing repo files to use
centos.   This also makes it easy for new tools like, test-patch
to switch between the platforms.

Next step will be to allow REPO_DEVICE=  to easily
setup the network interfaces in the multi node cases.

I think env vars are a simple way to handle this, but we could also
consider an user config file ~/openstack-chef-repo.cnf.  Thoughts?

Change-Id: I82e82b35b51e08ff503fdb10fa1ce041c4be4af2

commit_message:
utils: ignore block device mapping in system metadata

The 'mappings' and 'block_device_mappings' fields in the
image system metadata can be very large strings, as they
are json encodings of the entire disk config. The instance
system metadata table values are restricted in length,
which results in the mappings & block_device_mappings
fields being truncated

Change-Id: Ie5d354ba4377343b148acda4679c562fd8ed43d6

commit_message:
Add location to requirement.Requirement

This will provide space to store the result of parsing requirements
like -e file:///opt/stack/new/oslo.THING, which we need to do for
edit-constraint to work in devstack when more than one library is
being installed from git. This is a separate patch to make reviewing
the actual new functionality easier - it is entirely mechanical,
adding the field and dealing with test fallout.

Change-Id: Ied4e92717b0dab871dac42ae639d1f2a6c236414

commit_message:
Rely on VM UUID to fetch metrics in libvirt

VM instance name is inconsistent between nova parent node and nova cell node.
So it is necessary to rely on VM UUID (which is an unique ID and immutable for VM
resource) rather than instance name to fetch system metrics via libvirt’s
lookupByUUIDString API.

Change-Id: I59dad915185fb191b7712024697e7b15e9e759e4
Closes-bug: #1396473

commit_message:
Exclude yaql 0.3.0 from requirements

yaql 0.3.0 was developed as proof-of-concept, and later was
completely redesigned, it's not recommended for production usage.
Murano & Mistral will not be able to consume 0.3.0 as well, that's
why we should restrict installation of 0.3.0.

Change-Id: I25540b1be8a15e8ab83a9646693901e2af5e33cf

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-16 14:22:21.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/alarm/evaluator/test_threshold.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/threshold.py'], 'message': "Use alarm's evaluation periods in sufficient test

Currently, we use constant value quorum=1 to check if there are enough
datapoints, however, this is not quite right for an alarm rule.

Image evaluation periods is set to, for i.e., 3 for an instance on
cpu_util greater or equal than 80%. Here are the cases which current
may not work as expected:

1. when system start or instance is just created, we may only get one
or two samples for the instance
2. when system is somewhere broken, or an instance is restarted (after
being shutoff), sample may fail to be collected in some time, so we only
get one or two sample in that time range

We want to avoid a spurious data peak, for example, instance cpu_util can
be 50%, 50%, 50%, 90%, in such case, alarm will not be triggered, but if
instance cpu_util is None, None, None, 90%, current code will think alarm
should be triggered, which is not consistent and may confuse end users.

This patch will put alarm to insufficient data when datapoints are less
than evaluation periods.

Conflicts:
        ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/threshold.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the oslo.i18n imports on master
and oslo.i18n wasn't used in stable/juno so the _LW usage is removed.

Change-Id: Ie64a537434493a5965c8e9e165cf028d57689da2
Closes-Bug: #1380216
(cherry picked from commit 553d8d96e60cf354406568ed7dd4c563e768e4d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Use alarm's evaluation periods in sufficient test

Currently, we use constant value quorum=1 to check if there are enough
datapoints, however, this is not quite right for an alarm rule.

Image evaluation periods is set to, for i.e., 3 for an instance on
cpu_util greater or equal than 80%. Here are the cases which current
may not work as expected:

1. when system start or instance is just created, we may only get one
or two samples for the instance
2. when system is somewhere broken, or an instance is restarted (after
being shutoff), sample may fail to be collected in some time, so we only
get one or two sample in that time range

We want to avoid a spurious data peak, for example, instance cpu_util can
be 50%, 50%, 50%, 90%, in such case, alarm will not be triggered, but if
instance cpu_util is None, None, None, 90%, current code will think alarm
should be triggered, which is not consistent and may confuse end users.

This patch will put alarm to insufficient data when datapoints are less
than evaluation periods.

Conflicts:
        ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/threshold.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the oslo.i18n imports on master
and oslo.i18n wasn't used in stable/juno so the _LW usage is removed.

Change-Id: Ie64a537434493a5965c8e9e165cf028d57689da2
Closes-Bug: #1380216
(cherry picked from commit 553d8d96e60cf354406568ed7dd4c563e768e4d0)

commit_message:
Override opportunistic database tests to PyMySQL

Set the OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION override variable so that
oslo.db opportunistic detection will know to use PyMySQL until
I12b32dc097a121bd43991bc38dd4d289b65e86c1 makes it the default
behavior.

Change-Id: Ib22972011d8ba96cbbdfc7ce5b0aaf4ca04986a9

commit_message:
Storage Layer Implementation for Pipeline Configuration

and retrieval of pipeline sources, sinks and
transformers.

A gliffy-based schema diagram is at:
http://www.gliffy.com/go/publish/6816275

Co-Authored-By: Phil Neal <phil.neal@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fabio Giannetti <fabio.giannetti@hp.com>

fields in description i.e. threshold, comparision operator, statistic

commit_message:
Split bunch of samples into multiple messages

Currently, single message may contain large amount of samples,
which slows down the collector on storing samples to backend database.
With this patch, large amount of samples will be splitted into multiple messages,
which can effectively make use of multiple workers.

Change-Id: Idf22c66ca7626c4061ac1b527144d5d9db8b7516
Closes-bug: #1291923

- Added 'inspect_declared_meters()' in the 'Inspector' class. It will be

corresponding config file, for any given instance.

- Implemented 'DeclarativePollster' which will call the
Inspector.inspect_declared_meters() and generate samples for all

- Enabled 'VsphereOperations' to be able to query the stats for a list

Change-Id: I8796b7ddecbf0062beb83c6668c9ce1eaf7407af
Implements: blueprint vmware-vsphere-declarative-polling
"}]
commit_message:
VMware vSphere Declarative Polling

- Added 'inspect_declared_meters()' in the 'Inspector' class. It will be
responsible for inspecting the values of all meters declared in the
corresponding config file, for any given instance.

- Implemented 'DeclarativePollster' which will call the
Inspector.inspect_declared_meters() and generate samples for all
declared meters.

- Implemented the inspect_declared_meters() in 'VsphereInspector'.

- Enabled 'VsphereOperations' to be able to query the stats for a list
of counters (instead of one) for any VM.

Change-Id: I8796b7ddecbf0062beb83c6668c9ce1eaf7407af
Implements: blueprint vmware-vsphere-declarative-polling

subject: Avoid dead loop when update combination alarm
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-15 08:53:36.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py'], 'message': 'Avoid dead loop when update combination alarm

Dead loop scenario:
1. assume we have threhold alarm C, D
2. then we create combination alarm A with alarm_ids = C, D
3. and we create combination alarm B with alarm_ids = A
4. then we update alarm A with alarm_ids = B
5. then when evaluator alarm state, the two combination alarm is a dead loop

We should avoid such scenario

The basic idea is the following:
* all threshold alarms are good alarms, which definitely have no dependency,
  so there is no dead loop
* all alarms depending only on good alarms are good alarms

NOTE: This patch forbids updating alarm which will cause dead loop even though
it is disabled.

NOTE: If old environment already has dead loop combination alarms, after
upgrade with this patch, put /alarms/{id} api may not work util dead loop is
removed.

Change-Id: Ic4065db9243fb209026e6f5b154e19a705992607
Closes-Bug: #1309182
Implements: blueprint resolve-combination-alarm-dependency-chain
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid dead loop when update combination alarm

Dead loop scenario:
1. assume we have threhold alarm C, D
2. then we create combination alarm A with alarm_ids = C, D
3. and we create combination alarm B with alarm_ids = A
4. then we update alarm A with alarm_ids = B
5. then when evaluator alarm state, the two combination alarm is a dead loop

We should avoid such scenario

The basic idea is the following:
* all threshold alarms are good alarms, which definitely have no dependency,
  so there is no dead loop
* all alarms depending only on good alarms are good alarms

NOTE: This patch forbids updating alarm which will cause dead loop even though
it is disabled.

NOTE: If old environment already has dead loop combination alarms, after
upgrade with this patch, put /alarms/{id} api may not work util dead loop is
removed.

Change-Id: Ic4065db9243fb209026e6f5b154e19a705992607
Closes-Bug: #1309182
Implements: blueprint resolve-combination-alarm-dependency-chain

commit_message:
Rename Puppet jobs to avoid word duplication

Currently, jobs are named (example with puppet-heat):
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-lint
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-syntax
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-unit-X
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-beaker-rspec-upgrade-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-syntax-future

Let's rename all of them to:
gate-puppet-heat-lint
gate-puppet-heat-syntax
gate-puppet-heat-unit-X
gate-puppet-heat-beaker-rspec-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-beaker-rspec-upgrade-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-syntax-future

With the goal to improve readability.

Change-Id: Ia2ff46f89c90dceff3f614884b2a0cc3e0d5a13c

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-01 17:59:49.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Fixed the upgrade script edge case

Changed the command to find the containers to only look for the contianer
config file within a given directory and to only look one level deep.
This change is in response to an issue that can happen if the container
directory "/var/lib/lxc" is also a mounted file system.

Change-Id: Id39995580900e2b9d9a35435d0cfeba82075d62b
Closes-Bug: #1470571
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the upgrade script edge case

Changed the command to find the containers to only look for the contianer
config file within a given directory and to only look one level deep.
This change is in response to an issue that can happen if the container
directory "/var/lib/lxc" is also a mounted file system.

Change-Id: Id39995580900e2b9d9a35435d0cfeba82075d62b
Closes-Bug: #1470571

commit_message:
Stop using these variables

In order to register this plugin and its extensions, it suffices
adding the extension path to the list of the ones to be loaded.

Change-Id: Ic087b36f5b7a889455d8f1b785cfb6a35fa196ae

commit_message:
Rabbit config changes dont initiate a restart

Restart rabbit-server when the config files change. This required
the templates to be rendered from the post_install playbook to
prevent attempting to restart a service that had not yet been
installed.

Change-Id: I7c9ba030aa0e58d3fb5fa3cb6f17dd013f36471c
Closes-Bug: #1460115
(cherry picked from commit 90bef6a3c47580aaf99b81c6842404e027e01924)

subject: Use old puppet syntax job on system-config
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-03 16:48:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Use old puppet syntax job on system-config

The infra puppet modules do not yet have Gemfiles like the OpenStack
puppet modules do. For now, they have to use the macro to perform the
task. As the infra modules start supporting the standard method, these
can be converted to puppet-check-jobs.

Change-Id: I698162023e9a7be0bef375c092dd6a70535b8bb2
'}]
commit_message:
Use old puppet syntax job on system-config

The infra puppet modules do not yet have Gemfiles like the OpenStack
puppet modules do. For now, they have to use the macro to perform the
task. As the infra modules start supporting the standard method, these
can be converted to puppet-check-jobs.

Change-Id: I698162023e9a7be0bef375c092dd6a70535b8bb2

We should use the openstack.org ones.

commit_message:
Replace screenshots in User Guide

Replaces the following screenshots in user guide with new ones:
- for Install Fuel Master Node
- for Fuel Setup
- for Network Setup
- for PXE Setup
- for DNS & Hostname
- for Time sync with NTP
- for Fuel login
Removes the screenshot and info for docker0.
Removes the text (and screenshot accordingly) about
the showmenu option as now it's showmenu=yes
by default.
Adds a screenshot for Quit Setup.

Change-Id: I5956aef7a7d8965c64447cfe06942ffcba64f2a5
Closes-Bug: #1469141
Closes-Bug: #1469146

commit_message:
Remove old function extract_env_version

Until now we have two functions which were doing the same
The patch unifies it as follows:
* Rename Release model property from 'fuel_version'
  to 'environment_version' to make it more descriptive
* remove extract_env_version function, and replace it with
  environment_version property in Release model.

Closes-Bug: #1470524
Closes-Bug: #1470768
Change-Id: I7688f048468d6036fb326be82049ec50a7925386

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-26 21:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': "One network stack to rule them all

Nova has been trying to move to supporting a single network stack based
on neutron for several years now, and we are stuck in a bad place where
we support two separate network stacks. After numerous failed attempts to
change the default networking solution to neutron and start the
deprecation process for nova-networking, it is time to resolve this once
and for all.
Just deprecate nova's neutron support.

DNM

Change-Id: Ifd7481744891668e3a8b4398867778a952053c50
"}]
commit_message:
One network stack to rule them all

Nova has been trying to move to supporting a single network stack based
on neutron for several years now, and we are stuck in a bad place where
we support two separate network stacks. After numerous failed attempts to
change the default networking solution to neutron and start the
deprecation process for nova-networking, it is time to resolve this once
and for all.
Just deprecate nova's neutron support.

DNM

Change-Id: Ifd7481744891668e3a8b4398867778a952053c50

commit_message:
puppet/syntax: do not export FUTURE_PARSER when Puppet > 3

FUTURE_PARSER environment variable has no meaning any more from Puppet
4.

If you try to activate it in Puppet4, you'll have this error:
Attempt to assign a value to unknown setting :parser

Change-Id: I04d727842a9bd7e45cdbbdff99182dd8ef83c06c

commit_message:
Fix unit tests

- Updated script to improve functionality (see --help)
- Disabled unit tests for:
  - 'apache' they are broken in 1.2.0
  - 'ceilometer' rspec does not work in 4.0.0
  - 'firewall' rspec does not work in 1.0.2
  - 'horizon' rspec does not work in 5.0.0
  - 'memcached' rspec does not work in 2.5.0
  - 'monit' rspec does not work in 0.0.4
  - 'ntp' rspec does not work in 3.3.0
  - 'rabbitmq' rspec does not work in 5.5.0

Fuel-CI is disabled because this patch does not affect deployment,
so integration testing is not needed.

Partial-bug: #1455847
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I608ad6057ab3ef9c924c5b7b832f7c119b8f6b2a

commit_message:
pass baymodel date instead of bay data for baymodel create request

This patch just uses the correct request parameters for baymodel when
policy enforce the baymodel post method.

Acutally, without this patch, the testcase still can work.

Anyway, it is better to be more rigorous.

Change-Id: I95836b8370f13a8945be358a2ad663dcc7056d28
Closes-Bug: #1471074

commit_message:
Adds MonitorMetricTypeField enum field

Preparation for cleanup of the nova.compute.monitors modules to use a
versioned object interface. Here we add a new enum derivative field that
contains the current string keys used for metric "names" that the
compute monitors return in the get_metrics() calls. This allows us to
standardize these metric key names.

Change-Id: I47d3ed2d3c0f6a3c33eaa9539d38aaff2f4df573
Partial-bug: 1466929

add python-scciclient version number requirement

The current driver-requirements.txt has no version number requirement
for python-scciclient.
This patch adds the required python-scciclient version number in
driver-requirements.txt for the iRMC Power and Management modules.

subject: Fix tox -e py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 23:12:11.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix tox -e py34

Use a whitelist of tests known to pass on Python 3. With a working
tox -e 34 command, it becomes possible to add a py34 non-voting gate,
and then make the py34 gate voting to avoid Python 3 regressions.

Remove the py33 test environment since OpenStack is now focused on
Python 3.4 (Python 3.3 is no more tested by the OpenStack infra).

Blueprint python3

Change-Id: I47677bc457bcabcd6432cad18b05b3f181ec49ab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tox -e py34

Use a whitelist of tests known to pass on Python 3. With a working
tox -e 34 command, it becomes possible to add a py34 non-voting gate,
and then make the py34 gate voting to avoid Python 3 regressions.

Remove the py33 test environment since OpenStack is now focused on
Python 3.4 (Python 3.3 is no more tested by the OpenStack infra).

Blueprint python3

Change-Id: I47677bc457bcabcd6432cad18b05b3f181ec49ab

commit_message:
puppet: add puppet-unit-latest job

This non-voting job aims to run rspec tests without pining Puppet
version.
It will help us to see how behaves our modules with latest Puppet
release without breaking our CI.

Also, do not run this job in current stable branches because we only
supported Puppet < 4.0.

Change-Id: Id15e1a6d3b6210b73c0a2ae7750cfc5f0651f1f6

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-01 03:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "puppet: refactorize puppet-syntax job

Today we are running two kind of puppet-syntax jobs:
* Former puppet-syntax was useless because the same thing was running with
puppet-syntax-future.
* Former puppet-syntax-future were testing only Puppet 3.x release while
  Puppet 4 has been released.

This patch aims to:
* jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml: drop former puppet-syntax job
* jenkins/jobs/puppet-modules-jobs.yaml: rename puppet-syntax-future to puppet-syntax-{puppet_version} where
  we adapt the job to support both  Puppet 3.x and Puppet 4.x.
* jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml: drop useless gate-{name}-puppet-syntax-future since new puppet-syntax
  are part of puppet-check-jobs group.
* zuul/layout.yaml:
  * update puppet-syntax to use the new jobs
  * system-config: use new puppet-syntax jobs (old one is deleted)
  * puppet modules: drop useless puppet-syntax-future since it's part of puppet-check-jobs

Change-Id: I48320d361b0c22d088a0df7113a7a508de0f546d
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: refactorize puppet-syntax job

Today we are running two kind of puppet-syntax jobs:
* Former puppet-syntax was useless because the same thing was running with
puppet-syntax-future.
* Former puppet-syntax-future were testing only Puppet 3.x release while
  Puppet 4 has been released.

This patch aims to:
* jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml: drop former puppet-syntax job
* jenkins/jobs/puppet-modules-jobs.yaml: rename puppet-syntax-future to puppet-syntax-{puppet_version} where
  we adapt the job to support both  Puppet 3.x and Puppet 4.x.
* jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml: drop useless gate-{name}-puppet-syntax-future since new puppet-syntax
  are part of puppet-check-jobs group.
* zuul/layout.yaml:
  * update puppet-syntax to use the new jobs
  * system-config: use new puppet-syntax jobs (old one is deleted)
  * puppet modules: drop useless puppet-syntax-future since it's part of puppet-check-jobs

Change-Id: I48320d361b0c22d088a0df7113a7a508de0f546d

subject: Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 21:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'message': "Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: Ifeada55370bbd5b30418447c8fc1da101de2b774
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: Ifeada55370bbd5b30418447c8fc1da101de2b774
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>

commit_message:
Hyper-V: checks for existent Notes in list_instance_notes

If there are VMs with Notes = None, the Hyper-V Driver cannot
start, as it tries to iterate over None, which results in an
exception.

This commit adds a check if the Notes exist, before iterating over
them.

Closes-Bug: #1438638

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutils.py
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutilsv2.py

(cherry picked from commit 2c3da5462684c930436c9e91cb1e893e0936a331)

Change-Id: Icebdc03d7249fdf903b94b2f61f4891f5c9d6e50

commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

subject: redhat: install deltarpm before any Package
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-02 01:33:18.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/repo/redhat/redhat.pp'], 'message': "redhat: install deltarpm before any Package

To resolve RPM's deltas, we need to install the deltarpm tool
before installing any package.

It would solve this issue:
Execution of '/usr/bin/yum -d 0 -e 0 -y install python-nova' returned 1:
Delta RPMs disabled because /usr/bin/applydeltarpm not installed.

Change-Id: I69efaf87bbcc5f233e02eb380f9d0345e2e14a6c
"}]
commit_message:
redhat: install deltarpm before any Package

To resolve RPM's deltas, we need to install the deltarpm tool
before installing any package.

It would solve this issue:
Execution of '/usr/bin/yum -d 0 -e 0 -y install python-nova' returned 1:
Delta RPMs disabled because /usr/bin/applydeltarpm not installed.

Change-Id: I69efaf87bbcc5f233e02eb380f9d0345e2e14a6c

commit_message:
Enhance ShowNodeInfoDialog and dialogMixin

- Use React synthetic events to close dialogs on escape key
- Fix cursor for toggleable group headers
- Fix dialog jumping when toggling groups

Related to blueprint node-naming

commit_message:
set default limit to meter/sample queries

this patch makes existing limit options in meter and samples apis
mandatory. if not set explicitly, a default limit will be applied.

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Change-Id: Ie354e8e64a6f8677a0be7e75c34e8901cdffbc6a
Implements: blueprint mandatory-limit

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 16:15:37.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of duplicated creation of security groups in test_volume_boot_pattern

It turns out that a security group in test test_volume_boot_pattern
is created twice. The first security group is created in test itself,
the second security group is created in the method _boot_instance_from_

commit_message:
Get rid of duplicated creation of security groups in test_volume_boot_pattern

It turns out that a security group in test test_volume_boot_pattern
is created twice. The first security group is created in test itself,
the second security group is created in the method _boot_instance_from_
volume(). This patch fixes it. Now the security group is created once.

Change-Id: I1c10e80161880c7ad04f7c0f48d51cc03b6cbada

commit_message:
Snapshot download with authentication

Add new handler SnapshotDownload which returns empty response
with X-Accel-Redirect header. Nginx reads this header and
serves actuall snapshot file.

Also changed 'reverse' function location, let it be more
available for other modules.

Change-Id: Id46b533e8d2a8021d1fbb2e5d4284508e1181704
Implements: blueprint snapshot-download-with-auth

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6804, 'name': 'bruce-benjamin', 'email': 'bruce.benjamin@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'bruce-benjamin'}, {'_account_id': 7002, 'name': 'Yatin Kumbhare', 'email': 'yatinkumbhare@gmail.com', 'username': 'yatin.kumbhare'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 10584, 'name': 'Min Pae', 'username': 'sputnik13', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11744, 'name': 'Alec Hothan', 'email': 'ahothan@cisco.com', 'username': 'ahothan'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}, {'_account_id': 13362, 'name': 'Tan Lin', 'email': 'lin.tan@intel.com', 'username': 'zero'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-06-27 15:27:31.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/zmq-patterns-usage.rst'], 'message': 'New ZeroMQ driver implementation details

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-patterns-usage

This spec proposes a new zmq driver which should develop in parallel
to the existing one and should substitute the existing driver after
some stabilization period. This spec is extension of [1]
where was original proposal to implement a new zmq driver.

Existing driver implementation sticks to a universal socket pipeline approach.
This means that all messaging patterns are implemented over a single socket
pipeline.

In [1] there were proposed to develop new zmq driver and to switch from a splitted
universal forward(PUSH/PULL)+backward(PUB/SUB) pipeline to a unified REQ/REP
bidirectional pipeline. The change simplifies the driver implementation and
makes it more reliable but the pipeline still remains universal.

The main drawback of the universal pipeline is that it can not be optimized
for some specific messaging pattern. For example, if we would like to
make a FANOUT cast over a universal pipeline (PUSH/PULL or REQ/REP does not matter)
we have to emulate it over a number of direct casts while it could be
done over PUB/SUB zeromq pattern using a single api call.

This specification proposes to extend new zmq driver implementation
with several specific socket pipelines according to each messaging pattern.

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171131/

Change-Id: Ibb7d403f3b7fe5639345bf1540429e2b8506655a
'}]
commit_message:
New ZeroMQ driver implementation details

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-patterns-usage

This spec proposes a new zmq driver which should develop in parallel
to the existing one and should substitute the existing driver after
some stabilization period. This spec is extension of [1]
where was original proposal to implement a new zmq driver.

Existing driver implementation sticks to a universal socket pipeline approach.
This means that all messaging patterns are implemented over a single socket
pipeline.

In [1] there were proposed to develop new zmq driver and to switch from a splitted
universal forward(PUSH/PULL)+backward(PUB/SUB) pipeline to a unified REQ/REP
bidirectional pipeline. The change simplifies the driver implementation and
makes it more reliable but the pipeline still remains universal.

The main drawback of the universal pipeline is that it can not be optimized
for some specific messaging pattern. For example, if we would like to
make a FANOUT cast over a universal pipeline (PUSH/PULL or REQ/REP does not matter)
we have to emulate it over a number of direct casts while it could be
done over PUB/SUB zeromq pattern using a single api call.

This specification proposes to extend new zmq driver implementation
with several specific socket pipelines according to each messaging pattern.

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171131/

Change-Id: Ibb7d403f3b7fe5639345bf1540429e2b8506655a

Projects wish to capture their optional dependencies - things they

commit_message:
Enable optional dependencies in OpenStack projects

Projects wish to capture their optional dependencies - things they
need only when specific configuration options are enabled. We need to
make sure the plumbing works for this to allow them to do that.

Change-Id: Ibc80ffb11239c0ee1c2a44d40008b54480e7a681

commit_message:
Make live migration create a migration object record

The object is terminally updated based on whether the driver calls
the success or failure callback, which should be when things have
completely finished and properly reflect the driver's notion of
success.

Related to blueprint robustify-live-migration

Change-Id: I515ab9d67eb205fe171078826e69d1016ab3ebda

Then user is redirected to /dump (using XSendfile).
To prevent potential intruder from downloading sensitive data

Depends-On: Id46b533e8d2a8021d1fbb2e5d4284508e1181704

commit_message:
Change /dump url to internal in nginx conf

/dump is used for snapshot downloading - since we want to allow
only authenticated users, we change the url to /api/dump/
(which is handled by nailgun and authentication occurs).
Then user is redirected to /dump (using XSendfile).
To prevent potential intruder from downloading sensitive data
/dump should be changed to 'internal'.

Change-Id: I1ee2758e3f21803c82c3587e706f46877fcfbe9b
Implements: blueprint snapshot-download-with-auth
Depends-On: Id46b533e8d2a8021d1fbb2e5d4284508e1181704

subject: Fix _check_action_complete method to wait for object status change
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-02 02:14:44.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/os/heat/stack.py'], 'message': 'Fix _check_action_complete method to wait for object status change

Currently when deleting a node, senlin excepts the physical object
to change to DELETE_IN_PROGRESS very fast, but physical needs a
little time to change the status. So when the physical object is
not changing yet, return False back instead of raising an exception.

Change-Id: I724b77f6973e26e904f23e795f2aca2a90023de7
Closes-Bug: #1469953
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _check_action_complete method to wait for object status change

Currently when deleting a node, senlin excepts the physical object
to change to DELETE_IN_PROGRESS very fast, but physical needs a
little time to change the status. So when the physical object is
not changing yet, return False back instead of raising an exception.

Change-Id: I724b77f6973e26e904f23e795f2aca2a90023de7
Closes-Bug: #1469953

commit_message:
Support flavor object in migrate_disk_and_power_off

I11a28cd3b2eb98b42d78f9327ed6b38dc2bc8f30 makes resize rpc api to send flavor
object, so that we can use flavor object in migrate_disk_and_power_off().

Related to blueprint liberty-objects

Change-Id: If5368d3f15fea4157e5331349d818335514c83e3

commit_message:
Refactor network API 'get_instance_nw_info'

Refactor network API 'get_instance_nw_info' for
neutron and nova-network. Rewrite the common logic
in the base function of network.base_api,
and create an interface '_get_instance_nw_info'
so that subclass can implemented it.

Change-Id: I8f8d2db5a0a1180e4aada34c3aade855d9314611
